http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/gre.name: Woodstock Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/gre.description: Green Mountain Flour will be here to sample their AMAZING ready-made pizzas! Nothing like a delicious meal made easy!

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/dow.description: On Saturday, October 12, 2013 Downtown Rutland will celebrate the season with HarvestFest. The event, sponsored in part by VSECU, will run in conjunction with the downtown Farmer’s Market (in Depot Park) and Art in the Park (Main Street Park).   Downtown businesses will be open for normal or extended hours and many stores will offer special sales and promotions.From 9:00AM to 2:00PM Center Street will host activities bringing our downtown businesses out onto the sidewalks along with live jazz, local artisans and from 11:00AM to 2:00PM free hay rides.  Wonderfeet Kid’s Museum will host a variety of activities including a pumpkin scavenger hunt and scarecrow decorating. Don’t miss one of the busiest and most exciting days of the year in downtown Rutland.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/far.name: Green Mountain Girls Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/far.description: Scrag Mountain Music is coming back to the Farm!  Join us  for a delightful harvest meal direct from the farm and then world-class chamber music in the Barn’s event space.The musicians say it is because during the farm suppers they begin connecting with you who attend, sharing the meal, watching the goats, figuring out the key of a certain farm sound! And we in the audience are more enthralled than typical. We ate with the musicians, know them to be mortals—folks who share our penchant for farm fresh food. Connecting is not only a hunger, it is a feast.Prior to the 7pm Friday night concert, there will be a farm supper. The entirely local, cozy, seasonal meal will be available at the farmstand from 5:00 to 6:30pm. $20 for adults, children 12 and under $5.This meal will feature our pasture-raised meats and organically managed veggies of this season.  Please RSVP

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/har.address:
Brookfield Old Town Hall
32 Old Stone Road
categories: Eateries, Farmers Markets, Farm Visits, Classes & Workshops
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/har.description: The leaves are turning colors, the air is crisper and fall harvest crops are coming in. Join members of the Floating Bridge Food and Farms Cooperative for a Harvest focused afternoon of learning, eating, and shopping. Sunday, Oct 13rd the Floating Bridge Food and Farms Cooperative will offer visitors and residents the opportunity to celebrate the harvest season with a market inside Brookfield’s Old Town Hall. Local fresh produce, pasture-raised meats, pickles, cider and of course quality sweets including caramel, honey and maple syrup will be available as well as other great local products such as beeswax candles, and the new Vermont Farm Table Cookbook featuring Ariel's Restaurant. In addition to providing quality local food, the Floating Bridge Food and Farms Cooperative is committed to engaging people in farm-based, food centered educational opportunities. At the October Market, experience Cider Pressing first hand and learn about creating your own local dried flower arrangements. •	1pm & 3 pm Brookfield Bees will offer an Apple Cider Pressing Demonstration, cider will also be available for sale. •	2pm Spruce Lane Farm will offer tips for growing and making dried flower arrangementsCome for lunch or snack to fuel your shopping as delicious farm-fresh ready-to-eat items will be available, including:•	Local, Seasonal Gumbo from Ariel’s Restaurant•	Lamb Gyros•	Apple Cider •	Red Velvet Brownies and moreAbout the markets, Marda Donner of Brookfield Bees notes, “Our Market is a perfect confluence of community fellowship and the localvore movement.” So make a day of it: Come, eat, enjoy, meet and support your local farmers. In addition to the Harvest Market, Coop members offer unique opportunities to enjoy the splendor and awe of seasonal change framed by the intimacy of family farms and businesses. Check out opportunities from lattes on hoof and farm fresh dinners to cider pressing, farm tours and world class music. http://eatstayfarm.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/Foliage-opportunities-for-website.pdf

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/har.name: Champlain Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/har.description: Enjoy a huge feast of local meats, vegetables, and fruits, of course! Music by Southern Vermont’s favorite bluegrass band, the Bondville Boys. Known for their sweet harmonies, sick picking, off-topic stage banter, great energy, washboard solos and eclectic set lists, the Bondville Boys play a huge assortment of music, including original tunes and everything from Flatt & Scruggs to Blondie.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/the.name: Cedar Circle Farm & Education Center
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/the.description: A record-breaking 1,900 people attended this amazing event in 2012!Great food, kids activities and entertainment, wagon rides, pumpkin picking, live music by The Crunchy Western Boys, and so much more!Take the train to Pumpkin Festival! For details on the train contact the White River Flyer.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/yod.description: Looking for a nice way to spend a Sunday afternoon this fall? Come learn how to make apple cider! Yoder Farm in Danby is hosting a farm tour, which will include a description of their growing operation and techniques, as well as demonstrations on bean threshing and apple cider pressing. Yoder Farm collects apples from wild orchards, and as part of this tour, the farmers will demonstrate how to make cider with their unique water pressure cider press.Price: Sliding scale: $5-15; kids are freeTransportation is available from Downtown Rutland in the Price Chopper parking lot

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/29t.name: Billings Farm & Museum
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/29t.description: Voted by the Vermont Chamber of Commerce a Top 10 Fall Event for 2013The weekend features a husking bee and barn dance, plus a variety of 19th century harvest activities and programs for the entire family.  Each day a traditional husking bee will begin at noon, followed by a barn dance from 1:00 to 4:00 p.m. Lend a hand pressing cider, preserving apples, and threshing grain. Harvesting the heirloom vegetable garden will be nearing completion and children can help dig potatoes and other root crops and learn how crops are “put up” for the winter.Other activities include: making butter and ice cream, apples-on-a-string, and 19th century games. Hot-spiced cider and homemade doughnuts will be on hand for all! Admission includes all programs and activities.Admission: adults: $12.00; 62 and over: $11.00; children 5-15: $6.00; 3-4: $3.00; under 3: free.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/my-.name: Woodstock Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/my-.description: My Brigadeiro Chocolates will be here sampling some of their chocolate truffles! These truffles make the perfect holiday gift that is guaranteed to be a hit! Come in and try before you buy.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/win.name: Woodstock Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/win.description: Our Monthly Wine and Cheese Tasting continues with exploring a variety of Vermont Wines and Cheeses!

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/smu.address:
Smugglers' Notch Resort
4323 Vermont Route 108 South
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/smu.description: Now in its fifth year, Discover Food & Wine offers a memorable evening of tastings over the Columbus Day holiday weekend. This event during Vermont's legendary foliage season showcases the state's renowned specialty foods, from cheeses to chocolate to coffee and more. Wine tastings feature U.S. and international wines, plus a special selection from Vermont vineyards.Guests can mingle with and learn from enthusiastic food and wine experts while savoring delicious products in a beautiful mountain setting. The Resort's Morse Mountain Grille will offer a selection of mouth-watering appetizers.Individual tickets for Discover Food & Wine are priced at $29, which includes:Enjoyment of 12 wine tastings and a souvenir etched wine glass.Unlimited samplings of many of Vermont's delicious specialty foods such as cheeses, chocolates, maple products, sauces and marinades, baked goods, and more.A selection of tempting appetizers prepared by the Resort's Morse Mountain Grille.Musical accompaniment to this special evening is provided by singer Jenni Johnson, whose smooth voice mesmerizingly highlights jazz and blues classics.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/foo.name: Billings Farm & Museum
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/foo.description: This is a program designed for children and adults to learn how heirloom vegetables are used in historic recipes prepared in the 1890 Farm House kitchen. Foodways Fridays will feature recipes from the late 19th and early 20th centuries.Visitors can learn about the history, importance, and uses of old vegetable varieties, as they are prepared in the farmhouse kitchen. Each Friday will feature a different menu, which might include Ladies Cabbage, Flemish Carrots, Cymling Pudding, or Pink Velvet Soup. Recipes will be available to take home. Head out to the heirloom garden to chat with Billings Farm gardener or meet there to take a tour.Foodways Friday activities are included with regular admission to the Farm & Museum and no pre-registration is necessary. Admission: adults: $12.00; age 62 & up: $11.00; children ages 5-15: $6.00; 3-4: $3.00; under 3: free.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/hei.description: On Sunday October 13th, The Scott Farm will host its annual Heirloom Apple Day, a celebration of our heirloom apples, fresh, baked and squeezed. Visit our apple packing barn at 10, 12 or 2 for a free tasting and listen to the enlightening history of some of our 90 apple varieties with wonderful names such as Esopus Spitzenburg and Ananas Reinette. Heirloom Apples and cider will be on sale after the tasting.Come visit us on Apple Tasting Day and buy mixed bags of heirloom apples or many of one kind for eating out of hand, sauce making, pie baking, or a Tarte Tatin.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/foo.name: Billings Farm & Museum
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/foo.description: This is a program designed for children and adults to learn how heirloom vegetables are used in historic recipes prepared in the 1890 Farm House kitchen. Foodways Fridays will feature recipes from the late 19th and early 20th centuries.Visitors can learn about the history, importance, and uses of old vegetable varieties, as they are prepared in the farmhouse kitchen. Each Friday will feature a different menu, which might include Ladies Cabbage, Flemish Carrots, Cymling Pudding, or Pink Velvet Soup. Recipes will be available to take home. Head out to the heirloom garden to chat with Billings Farm gardener or meet there to take a tour.Foodways Friday activities are included with regular admission to the Farm & Museum and no pre-registration is necessary. http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/mak.name: Green Mountain Girls Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/mak.description: Do you love chevre? Have you been curious about making it at home? It is fun and easy to make your own delicious dairy products made from fresh, local organically raised milk and chevre is a great place to start!The workshop is a hands-on class that will walk through all of the steps to make chevre from farm fresh goat milk. From milk to serving. Cost: $25/person. Includes hands-on instruction, recipes, meeting the goats and samples, of course.  Please register via email.Farmstand Members receive a 10% discount; Omnivore Share members receive a 20% discount.

http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/cid.name: Champlain Orchards
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Eateries, Breweries, Farm Visits
http://www.diginvt.com/events/detail/cid.description: Local makers of the best food and drink in the state offer tastes to Ciderfest! participants. Music by Run Mountain – from rollicking fiddle hoedowns to mountain ballads to hillbilly blues, old-time string band Run Mountain breathes new life into American roots music. Run Mountain combines the talents of Paula Bradley, Bill Dillof and Jim Burns into an exciting and engaging ensemble, featuring powerful vocals accompanied by banjo, fiddle, guitar, harmonica & ukulele, with flatfoot dancing to boot!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.name: Hill Farmstead Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.description: Hill Farmstead Brewery is the culmination of many years of travel and insight—of experience and education—of friendships and explorations.The brewery is the revival and continuation of 220 years of Hill heritage and hand crafted history in North Greensboro, Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/m-r.name: M.R. Harvest
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/m-r.hours: Please call ahead for visiting hours.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/m-r.description: We produce a wide selection of Certified Organic vegetables. Our produce is available at our vegetable stand, the Grand Isle, South Hero and Essex Farmers Markets, local area stores and through our Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) program. Send us an email (tom@mrharvest.com) or call (802-372-8922) if you have questions.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cra.name: Craftsbury Outdoor Center
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cra.description: A small lakeside resort offering cross country skiing and adult sports camps with a focus on sustainability and local foods. We are a green hotel.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.name: Graze and Gaze Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.hours: Farm visits are welcome by appointment. Call 802-479-2778 or 802-249-8547. Customers are welcome to visit and purchase products at the farm stand  as well as brief visits to checkout the cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.description: A family farm in Barre, VT. Bill and Loretta along with help from their adult children, Bill, Rachel, Andrew and Joe, raise grass fed beef, pastured pork, free range chicken and eggs, broiler chickens, and turkeys, both traditional and heritage breeds. All of our animals are humanely and naturally raised with access to the outdoors year round. Beef is rotationally grazed, grass fed. Pigs are pastured, forage, and supplemented with hay and grain. There is no routine use of antibiotics or other medications. Hormones are never used. Cows are vaccinated against common pathogens including rabies.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.name: Middlebury Inn, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.hours: Breakfast 7am-10am Daily, Lunch 11am-2pm Monday-Friday, Afternoon Tea 2:30pm-4:30pm Daily and Dinner 5:30-9pm Wednesday – Sunday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.description: Our restaurants goal is to use only the freshest ingredients of the highest quality. Our comfort selections and classic cuisine always makes heads turn and always fills large appetites. Come and let our staff take care of you.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hyd.name: Hyde Away Inn & Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hyd.hours: Dining Hours: Tavern: Mon. - Sun.: 4:00 PM - Close, Dining Room: Mon. - Sun.: 5:30 PM - Close
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hyd.description: The Hyde Away Inn and Restaurant is a farmstead, circa 1824, located in the Mad River Valley in the heart of Vermont’s Green Mountains.Nestled between the quaint, historic villages of Waitsfield and Warren, the inn opened New Year’s Day, 1949 as the Ulla Lodge — a comfortable haven with friendly people, good food and a casual tavern where you can relax with friends before turning in for the night in one of our cozy rooms.The Inn consists of nine rooms for lodging (some pet friendly), a full service restaurant and tavern — all of which are open daily, year round. A popular spot for locals and tourists alike, The Hyde Away is one of the few establishments in the Valley that offers dining, drinking and lodging under one roof. Year ’round, the tavern and restaurant attract a regular crowd of locals and visitors who return year after year for the comfortable, friendly atmosphere, friendly staff, affordable pricing, and good food.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/anj.name: Anjali Farms, LLC
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/anj.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Farm Visits, Classes & Workshops
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/anj.description: Anjali Farms is nestled on ten acres of gentle south slope above the West River in the village of South Londonderry. We have been growing Certified Organic heirloom vegetables, shitake mushrooms, culinary and medicinal herbs since 1998. A small flock of gallivanting chickens lay eclectic eggs and help us work the land. During the growing season, there are many special events on the farm. We also host students of all ages in both the field and our Barn Classroom. We host farm tours, special events, internships and workshops. Last season we hosted over 40 students from area grade schools on the farm.  Summer harvest and Fall foliage weekly apartment rentals available on farm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pun.name: Puntey Mountain Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pun.hours: Open 11:00 am – 5:00 pm seven days a week
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pun.description: At Putney Mountain Winery we create Vermont fruit wines of complexity and finesse. They’ve been described in the press as “extraordinary,” “love at first taste,” and even “an intensely remarkable treasure.”Whether you’re looking for a sparkling wine to tickle your palate, a table wine to complement a meal, or a dessert wine that raises the simplest dessert to a new level, we have a wine you’ll savor.You will also love our Putney Bubbly™ sparkling juices. Putney Mountain Winery makes its non-alcoholic sparkling juices with the same commitment to creating the best taste of Vermont from the most valuable Vermont fruit.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.name: Shelburne Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.address: Shelburne Center on Route 7 and Church St
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.description: The Shelburne Farmers Market was started by the SBPA in 2006 to bring local Vermont produce to Shelburne and surrounding communities. It makes available Vermont vegetables, fruit, herbs, honey maple syrup grown on local farms. Also available are prepared foods and Vermont crafts. The market opens the end of May and runs through the second week in October on Saturdays from 9:00 to 1:00. It is located in Shelburne center on Route 7 and Church Street with ample parking available.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.name: Champlain Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.description: Located in Shoreham, Vermont, our apple orchard and organic farm overlooks Lake Champlain and the Adirondack Mountains. We are a family-owned Vermont orchard that takes pride in growing a diversity of ecologically-grown fruits and vegetables. Our fresh produce and unique value-added products attest to our commitment to Vermont’s local food economy. Stop by our Farm Market to pick up fresh apples and vegetables, homemade cider donuts, apple pies, and all of the other great local products we carry!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.name: Lunchbox Market - Island Pond
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.description: The Lunchbox is a mobile farmers’ market and commercial kitchen that brings locally grown food and food-based education to communities in northern Vermont. The market’s mission is to improve fresh food access, provide a reliable outlet for new and small scale growers and value-added producers, and to create a gathering place for community activities and meals. We’ll accomplish this by: Visiting sites including senior meal sites and low-income housing sites once per week with fresh produce, dairy, meat, and flour from local farms. We’re looking to expand to prepared food in the Spring. Leading workshops on cooking, food preservation, and other food topics. Creating a vibrant community hub with shared meals, skills, and the arts.Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rut.name: Rutland Downtown Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rut.hours: May 11 - October 30: Saturdays 9:00am-2:00pm; May 14 - October 15: Tuesdays 3:00pm-6:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rut.description: Our agricultural vendors offer high quality vegetables and fruits in season, eggs, cheese, mushrooms, honey, maple syrup, cut flowers, herbs, annuals, perennials, and more.  Our bakers provide delicious, oven fresh breads, rolls, cookies, pies and other sweet treats.  Food vendors bring a wide variety of specialty foods, sauces, jams, jellies, and pickled veggies.  Talented local artists and crafts people present their jewelry, wood crafts, paintings and pottery at the market.  We are a producer only market! EBT and Debit accepted!Winter market held weekly at the Old Strand Theater November through March Saturdays 10:00am-2:00pm.  Hours extended to 3:00 PM between Thanksgiving and Christmas.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: North Branch Vineyards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: Family owned and operated, North Branch Vineyards is a small winery, which lies beside the NorthBranch River, a branch on the Winooski River in Montpelier’s picturesque valley.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.name: Three Tomatoes Trattoria - Rutland
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.description: Our chef and cooks take great pride in creating the flavorful foods of Italy. With a flair all their own, they turn home style cooking into deliciously satisfying meals - every lunch and dinner.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rut.name: Rutland Winter Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rut.description: The market hosts over 45 vendors, selling everything from fresh salad greens all winter to locally-grown apples and cider all the way through til spring!With local wools, grass-fed meats, artisan cheeses, freshly baked breads, honey, jellies & jams, maple syrup & maple products, amazing hot foods, wines, and crafts rounding out the mix, the market is a great place to shop, eat, and visit.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.name: Cabot Quechee Store
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.hours: Open 9:30am - 5:30pm, Closed on Thanksgiving, Christmas & New Years Day
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.description: Nibble your way through generous samplings of Cabot's award-winning flavored and traditional cheeses, including the World's Best Cheddar.  Shop our exquisite collection of handcrafted products from the Best of Vermont — our partnership with some of the most talented artisans in America who call Vermont home.  Discover an impressive array of Vermont specialty foods and savor a full taste of why this small state has a big reputation for premium products.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.name: Allen Family Maple
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.hours: At our sugarhouse in Starksboro during the spring, the rest of the year by appointment.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.description: We are a maple syrup producer. Our sugarhouse is located at 1248 VT Rte 116, Starksboro, VT 05487

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lab.name: Labour of Love Landscaping & Nursery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lab.hours: We are open daily until dark.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lab.description: Open for viewing daily until dark. From April bulb bloom until hard frosts, over 800 varieties of Zone-3-hardy perennials (both field-grown & potted), the retail gardens & antiques, craft, & gift shop are open weekends and evenings (other times by appointment). From alpine miniatures to background giants, English cottage gardens to formal displays, a breathtaking succession of flowering is available for your home and business. We are fully insured, gift certificates available.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nat.name: Natural Provisions Market & Deli
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nat.hours: Natural Provisions Market and Deli is open Monday through Saturday 8am-8pm and Sundays from 8am-6pm.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nat.description: Natural Provisions Market and Deli carries a large selection of organic, natural and Vermont made products. Selections include bulk, health and beauty, produce and groceries. The Deli offers both eat in and take out options as well as catering for your office parties and meetings or family functions. The coffee bar contains fair trade coffees as well as fresh made pastries from our deli.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sim.name: Simon Pearce Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sim.description: The Simon Pearce Restaurant was originally established in The Mill in 1983 as the Glassblower's Cafe -- a place where visitors could enjoy lunch overlooking the falls of the Ottauquechee River and its covered bridge. All of the glassware and pottery used in the restaurant is hand made by our own glassblowers and potters. The restaurant is acclaimed as one of Vermont's finest, drawing GOURMET MAGAZINE'S highest rating from food critic Peter S. Jennison, who writes, "The coarse Ballymaloe bread that arrives at your table with a crock of sweet butter is, almost alone, worth the trip. We have never been disappointed by the cuisine." House specialties include homemade breads and soups, fresh salads, seafood, horseradish crusted cod and an award-winning wine list. We are committed to our local farmers and feature locally grown produce whenever the seasons allow.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green Mountain Maple Sugar Refining Company, Inc.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: Green Mountain Maple Sugar provides Vermont pure maple syrup and maple products.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tan.name: Tanglewoods Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tan.description: Tanglewoods Restaurant serves creative American cuisine in a cozy Vermont barn. Featuring the freshest seafood and local products available. Chef/owned and operated.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.name: All Together Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.description: We are a family owned and operated farm located in Randolph Center, VT. Our farm sits on nine grassy acres in central Vermont, an ideal setting for small-scale, pasture raised meat production.  All of our animals enjoy fresh, green grass during the pasture season, and all of work the goes into the products we sell is done by our family.We are always open to having visitors, and we encourage meat buyers to come up and see our operation.  Many of our customers like to see how their meat is grown and we definitely encourage anyone to come up and take a look.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cal.name: Caledonia Spirits
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cal.description: Our distillery is rooted in Vermont agriculture and beekeeping.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sus.name: Sustainable Farmer
categories: Cheese, Maple Syrup, Classes & Workshops, Food Markets
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sus.description: We have a retail store in Windsor, Vermont that is a showcase for our honey and maple products. The store also carries an incredible selection of the best cheese from Vermont dairy farms. Stop in any time to enjoy a sample of any of our cheese.In the Winter, we hold special tastings, pairings and cheese making classes where people get to learn more about all of our products.  In the Summer we use the store to hold classes on sustainable beekeeping. Please check our calendar for upcoming events.The store is located in the Artisans Park in Windsor, Vermont.  We are located 1 mile south of Exit 9 off Interstate 91. We are open 7 days a week from 11-5pm.We have great neighbors in the Harpoon Brewery, Simon Pearce Glass Factory, Silo Distillery, Great River Outfitters, Vt Farmstead Cheese and the Path of Life Sculpture Garden.  You can easily plan on spending a day in the park as there is so much to see and do.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.name: Three Tomatoes Trattoria- Williston
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.description: We strive to find the freshest ingredients, which often means working directly with small family farms here in Vermont. We use Mediterranean recipes to inspire us, using that style of cooking to create dishes whose simplicity allows the essence of every ingredient to take its turn at center stage. And we've worked to bring everything to you in a relaxed atmosphere, so you have the opportunity to savor not just the food but the company as well.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.name: Stowe Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.description: We are located on Route 108, Mountain Road about 2 miles from the intersection of Route 100 and Route 108. We are next to the Red Barn Shops and across from The Stoweflake Resort.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roy.name: Royalton Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roy.description: Stop by and check it out. The farmers market is located in South Royalton, Vermont at South Royalton Town Green. Check out the selection of local specialties, organic food, crafts, vegetables and fruits.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.name: Boyden Valley Winery and Spirits
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.hours: Open May 1st - December 31st  Daily 10am - 5pm and January 1st - April 31st  Friday thru Sunday 10am-5pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.description: We welcome you to come and join us at Boyden Valley Winery for a truly unique Vermont wine experience. Come by to taste wine and take a tour of our winemaking facility with our friendly staff. You are always welcome to come and enjoy cheese and a glass of wine upstairs in our historic carriage barn or outside on our terrace. Nestled on a beautiful Vermont farm on a hillside, Boyden Valley Winery is the perfect place for locals or tourists to drink a quality glass of wine and to experience why we are “Making Vermont Famous for Wine.”  We will see you at the winery, cheers!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/abb.name: Abbey Restaurant, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/abb.hours: Pub Open Daily 11:30-Closing, Pub  Open Daily 11:30-Closing, Sunday Brunch 9:3oam - 12:30pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/abb.description: Welcome To The Abbey- where the food is great, the people are fun and the tractors are inside. Whether you know all the staff by their first name or you're just passing through, make sure to visit the heart of Franklin County. We will be waiting for you.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hol.name: Hollister Hill Farm
categories: Inns & B&B's, Farm Visits, Farmstands & U-Pick, Farm Stays
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hol.description: The best decision we ever made was moving to Vermont back in 1972. Maybe one of the best decisions you’ll make this year is to stay at our Bed and Breakfast and visit our farm.Vermont is truly a special place and one of the things that make it so special is its working landscape. We had no idea that we would become farmers but one cow changed our lives forever. Starting out as back-to-the-landers, to full blown dairy farmers, to B&B hosts and diversified farmers, the many twist and turns in our farming career have led us back to milking four lovely Jersey cows once again.Our guests love this place and appreciate the fact that we share our lifestyle with them. They write in our guest book that we are friendly and warm, our farm raised food for our breakfasts, exceptional, and conversations enjoyable and interesting. Folks feel that they learn and share a lot while they are here. Once you are in Vermont and stay at our farm, you will experience a gentler way of living on this planet. We hope that this feeling will stay in your thoughts and hearts for a long time to come. We invite you to visit this place we call home.First opened in 2001, we started offering for sale our own naturally/organically raised Beefalo beef, pork, chickens, turkeys, eggs and maple syrup. All 100% anti-biotic and hormone-free products and produced right here at our farm. Folks from all over the area came and enjoyed our products, these were the early days of the localvore movement.  Our customers and especially the kids love being on the farm and visiting with the animals. Our animals are raised with the utmost of care and respect. They have a happy, healthy life while they are here at Hollister Hill Farm.In 2009 we had the opportunity to expand the farm store. Not only did we make it bigger but we made it more energy efficient. We are now selling organic vegetables and berries from Lee’s garden as well. But, the most wonderful part of this opportunity, we were able to start milking a few cows again. Many of our customers when asked if they would be interested in buying raw milk from us were very enthusiastic. So, we added a milk room/dairy equipment and bought four lovely Jersey cows. Having dairy cows on our farm again makes our farm feel complete.You now have the opportunity to be a localvore yourself. At our farm you will find small farm raised food at fair prices.Our store is open daily 9am-5pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green Mountain Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.hours: Breakfast served 7:30-10:30am daily Lunch served 11:30am-5:30pm daily Dinner served 5:30pm-10:00pm nightly Sun Brunch served 11:00am-2:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: Offering some of the best accommodations in Stowe, Vermont, the Green Mountain Inn offers the perfect blend of modern comfort and classic touches in 107 unique guest rooms, luxury suites and village townhouses.  Guests enjoy two acclaimed restaurants; our Main Street Dining Room for our breakfast buffet and special holiday dining and our Whip Bar and Grill Restaurant for lunch and dinner where you can enjoy our hand cut steaks, creative seafood specials, vegetarian dishes, homemade bread and desserts.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hap.name: Happy Valley Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hap.hours: Fall Pick Your Own- Mon - Sun: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hap.description: We have apples on the stand and for picking in addition to fresh local produce, baked goods and Vermont specialities.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.name: Stone Hearth Inn & Tavern
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.hours: Lunch: Saturday and Sunday 12pm - 3pm; Dinner: Thursday - Monday 5pm - 9:30pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.description: A friendly and relaxing atmosphere paired with Vermont's natural beauty and charm creates a memorable experience.  A small restaurant that supports and promotes community. We are always looking for ways to improve our product and keep our business local.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.name: Woodman Hill Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.hours: Seasonally open 10am - 6pm daily during apple harvest
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.description: We are a micro-orchard serving the city of Vergennes and all surrounding towns in northern Addison County. The trees were planted in 2002 focusing on a pick-your-own concept with low scaffold branches to make it easy for small family members to pick. The orchard has over 250 trees to choose from including several popular varieties - Honeycrisp, McIntosh, Empire, Cortland, Macoun, Liberty, Redfree, Rome and Sweet 16. All trees receive pesticide sprays following weekly guidance from the University of Vermont and Cornell University using the latest Integrated Pest Managements practices. This practice requires monitoring both fungus and insect activity within the orchard. We then use a very conservative approach to correct a problem if it exceeds specific economic thresholds. We hope that you will enjoy our orchard as much as we do, and don’t forget to buy local.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/old.name: Old North End Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/old.description: Come visit us at our new location - Dewey Park! (Intersection of Archibald and Elmwood and Spring and Walnut!). Vermont Products sold at the market include: local, fresh fruit and vegetables, scrumptious bread and baked goods, delicious prepared ethnic foods, pickles, local crafts, house plants, and bedding plants.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pea.name: Peacham Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pea.description: Peacham Farmers Market On the Peacham Academy Green In the Village of Peacham, Vermont. Every Thursday from 3 to 6 PM. Rain or Shine. June 13th through OctoberWinter market held weekly at the Peacham Craft Guild October through February Sundays 10:00am-2:00pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sey.name: Seyon Lodge State Park
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sey.hours: Open year round. Closed Nov 12 - Dec 28, 2011 & Mar 18 - Apr 19, 2012
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sey.description: Seyon Lodge State Park has an inn secluded on Noyes Pond in Groton State Forest. The Inn includes a large living room with fireplace and dining room. Activities in the park include fly-fishing, snowshoeing, x-country skiing and hiking. Conference room available. Dining available at the Lodge.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pis.name: Pistou
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pis.hours: Winter hours are Tuesday-Saturday 5:30-9.  Closed Sundays and Mondays.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pis.description: Pistou features contemporary American cuisine prepared with both classic and modern French technique.  We strive to serve the best possible food made with high quality, seasonal ingredients

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/two.name: Two Brothers Tavern
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/two.description: Since its inception in 2002, Two Brothers Tavern has become a favorite among locals, students and visitors alike for our award-winning cuisine, live entertainment and welcoming atmosphere. Charismatic, conversation-filled and family-run, Two Brothers Tavern epitomizes a quintessential Vermont dining experience.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.name: Harriman's Farm to Table at the Grand Summit Hotel at Mount Snow
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.description: Located conveniently on the ground floor of the Grand Summit Resort Hotel, the Harriman’s Farm to Table menu features exciting creations using as many fresh, local products as possible to truly bring you a genuine farm-to-table experience in a casual fine dining atmosphere.  The entire family will savor the diverse offerings that range from fresh seafood and fine cuts of beef to flavorful pasta dishes and traditional favorites as well as a children’s menu.  Enjoy a specialty martini or a local draft beer at the bar where live music is played on Friday and Saturday nights.  Harriman’s Farm to Table is open daily for cocktails, pub food and dinner. Breakfast is served on the weekends and holidays.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.name: Shelburne Museum Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.description: Shelburne Museum’s cafe features dining indoors in our open and airy dining room or outdoors at picnic tables. Choose from fresh salads, sandwiches and flatbread pizza or order from the grill. The cafe serves Vermont meats, cheeses and beverages whenever possible.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.name: Grateful Hands Brewing
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.description: Grateful Hands Brewing produces small (20 gallon) batches of dark ales, focusing on quality not quantity. We are not a large company and have no desire to become a large company. We desire to stay small, local, and dependable. We always want to keep the creativity and fun involved in making and taking care of our beer so that it is always as enjoyable for you to drink it! We are Grateful to be able to share our beer with you. Cheers!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.name: Chelsea Royal Diner
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.description: A local landmark, continues to serve good food fast, to the local and traveler alike. Offering local grass fed beef, our garden veggies (in season) and produce purchased locally. Open 364 days a year. Serving Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner daily.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.name: Maple Wind Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.hours: Please visit the website or call 802.434.7257 for more information.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.description: Maple Wind Farm is a pasture-based, diversified livestock operation located in Huntington, VT.  We produce grass fed & finished beef and lamb, and pastured, organically fed pork and poultry.  We are committed to quality products produced in a sustainable environment. Maple Wind Farm also offers seasonal Yurt rentals. The Yurts are located on our 140-acre farm with wonderful opportunities to hike, snowshoe and backcountry ski right out the yurt door, for all abilities. Paths from the farm link up with the Long and Catamount Ski Trails (hiking and ski trails that run the length of Vermont). In addition to managed trails, you can also enjoy wandering the open meadows of our farm as well as escaping into the woods to catch glimpses of many kinds of birds and woodland creatures.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.name: The Kitchen at The Store
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.description: Whether it's one of our culinary series classes taught by our in house instructor, or a demo class by a famous guest chef, the low student to teacher ratio makes for an intimate experience. You might learn how to make Udon noodles from scratch or experiencing the localvore movement first hand with a trip to the local farmers market and then preparing the Vermont farm fresh foods in a class The Kitchen at The Store is on the cutting edge of the culinary world.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/app.name: Apple Hill Orchard & Farm Stand
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/app.description: Growers of many varieties of apples & vegetables. We also have apple pies.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ari.name: Ariel's Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ari.hours: May-October: Wednesday-Sunday 5:30-9:30; November: Closed; December - March: Thursday-Saturday: 5:30-9:30 April: Closed
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ari.description: A short drive South from Vermont's capital, we discovered an unspoiled village on a small lake surrounded by hills among welcoming people. On this site we chose to create our home and restaurant. We see it as a haven where you will be welcomed warmly and offered fine and imaginative food along with carefully chosen wines in a romantic and comfortable environment.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bel.name: Bellows Falls Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bel.description: Farmers Market May 10 through Oct 11, 2013! Located at the Waypoint Center Parking Lot from 4 to 7 pm Fridays rain or shine. The Waypoint Center is located across from the Bellows Falls Railroad Station. Plenty of free parking, weekly music, special events and community. Local and organic vegetables, fruit, pork, beef, lamb, chicken, eggs, maple syrup, honey, jellies, jams, breads, baked goods, flowers, prepared foods and more! Visit our website and check out our exciting calendar of events. New this year is open mic night the fourth Friday of every month! EBT and Debit accepted!Monthly Winter Market at the Train Depot in Bellows Falls running from November  - May  Saturdays 10:00am-2:00pm

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mad.name: Mad Tom Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mad.hours: 9-5:30 daily except closed on Mondays; July for raspberries; Sept & Oct for Apples
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mad.description: We are a family owned pick your own orchard with apples and raspberries. Bring your family and enjoy our fruit and the views.  We are located on Mad Tom Road 2 1/2 miles from US RT 7 at the East Dorset General Store.  Look forward to seeing you!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cit.name: City Market / Onion River Coop
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cit.description: Ecological means of food production and distribution; provides educational materials on nutrition and agriculture and more. Deli-style restaurant located in store.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sou.name: South Burlington Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sou.description: The South Burlington Farmer's Market, previously hosted by Healthy Living Market and Cafe, will be located at the SB Middle/High School parking area in 2013. Although Common Roots will manage the market, Healthy Living Market and Cafe remains a key partner. In conjunction with the South Burlington School District and the greater community, Common Roots will schedule fun activities, educational opportunities, and local artist performances at the majority of the 20 Sunday markets.  EBT and Debit Accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mir.name: Mirabelles
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mir.description: Voted Best Bakery in Chittenden County. Breakfast served every day until 2:30 p.m.: omelets, croissants, pancakes and organic coffee. Innovative lunch specials and great sandwiches—all made to order with an an emphasis on local ingredients. A huge selection of fine cakes, pastries, muffins, scones and cookies. Everything is made from scratch.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/leu.name: Leunig's Bistro
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/leu.description: The spirit of old Europe and the panache of Paris, right in the center of Downtown Burlington.  Leunig's Bistro & Café is the popular, award winning restaurant bringing the panache of Paris and the value of Vermont into the heart of Downtown Burlington, Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/chu.name: Church & Main Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/chu.description: Church & Main is an innovative and dynamic restaurant located on the corner of Church Street and Main Street in downtown Burlington, Vermont.An inspired dining venue that supports sustainability and community activism, Church & Main will source a majority of its ingredients and products from local purveyors. The ideals of sustainable agriculture and aquaculture, community support, Vermont, and the belief that providing the best product at the best price create the core values of Church & Main.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.name: Chapin Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.hours: Each fall we open our orchards and visitor center to the public from September 1st to October 31, Seven days a week, 9:30 - 5:30
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.description: For well over 100 years Chapin Farm and Orchard has been a landmark in Essex, VT. We offer pick-your-own apples, a fully stocked retail and visitor center, gift certificates, field trips, and more.At Chapin Orchard our mission is to produce high quality fruit and farm products using management practices that encourage a sustainable orchard environment. Through careful and minimal use of pesticides, applied only when needed, we provide customers with healthy and good tasting fruit and cider. We also aim to further your enjoyment and experience of a visit to Chapin Orchard by offering a wide selection of Vermont farm products and crafts in our retail center. We choose products that support working Vermonters, family farms, local businesses and the local economy.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.name: Grafton Village Cheese Company - Brattleboro
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.description: Our Brattleboro Specialty Cheese & Wine Shop is located close to Route 91, across from the river and next to the Retreat Petting Farm.  A visit to our Brattleboro store includes an opportunity to watch our cheddar being made via our viewing area.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rel.name: Reluctant Panther Inn & Restaurant, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rel.description: Recognized by Zagat as the highest rated boutique hotel on the East Coast, the Reluctant Panther, located in the heart of Manchester Village, offers 20 rooms and suites of the highest quality and an exceptional dining experience. The Panther's spacious accommodations feature antique furnishings, fireplaces, marble baths and original, museum quality artwork. These elegant design details combined with 300 thread count linens, Anichini coverlets and Frette robes create a truly gracious and relaxing overnight experience. The Reluctant Panther Restaurant features contemporary American cooking in a relaxed yet elegantly upscale atmosphere. With an emphasis on locally sourced products, our Chef creates a sophisticated dining experience that is unsurpassed in northern New England. Paired with a Wine Spectator award winning wine list, dinner at the Panther is an easy-paced, artistic and celebratory event. It satisfies and stimulates the palate while reinforcing a sense of place and reasserting value for the regional landscape.  Our culinary philosophy extends to breakfast service and is included with every stay!The raw bar is open for the summer.  View the menu at http://reluctantpanther.com/uploads/pdf/RawBarMenu_2013.pdf.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/win.name: Windsor Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/win.description: Celebrating farmers and artists in Windsor, Vermont on Sundays from 11:30am - 2:30pm on the State Street Common.  Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/per.name: Perry Family Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/per.description: We are a small diverse hill farm nestled in the Green Mountains of Central Vermont.  We believe diversity is crucial to maintaining a healthy environment.  Our bespoke designed and constructed accommodation is relaxing and comforting. Cook your locally purchased foods in your own fully equipped kitchen. Entertain friends inside or outside on the deck with views over rolling countryside, distant mountains, and the roaming farm animals.  The apartment has one queen bedroom with a private bath. There is a second queen room available, separate from the apartment but sharing the patio courtyard. This room also has its own private bathroom.  We are located centrally in the Green Mountain State. Local to the state capitol, Montpelier, and several ski resorts including Sugarbush and Mad River Glen. There are plenty of excellent restaurants in the area, many of which serve locally grown food.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ame.name: American Flatbread at Lareau Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ame.hours: Restaurant hours: Friday and Saturday evenings 5:30-9:30.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ame.description: American Flatbread celebrates artisan baking and cuisine.  Every flatbread is hand-made entirely from organic and all natural ingredients and baked in a wood-fired clay oven.  Food & Wine Magazine July 2003 writes: "With the impeccable crust, sublime toppings this pizza justifies a 7-hour drive."

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cal.name: Caledonia Farmers' Market - St. Johnsbury
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cal.description: The Farmers' Market is open from mid-May to mid-October, every Saturday from 9:00 am until 1:00 pm.  EBT and Debit Accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Greene's Ox Pasture Maples
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.hours: Visitors are welcome anytime by appointment
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: Ox Pasture Maples is a family owned and operated business located in scenic Richford and East Berkshire, VT.  Our operation is of the traditional wood fired variety with a mixture of the traditional and modern.  We produce what we believe is one of the finest examples of traditional Organic Vermont Maple Syrup.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: Northwest Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: Make the market a regular stop this year. The people are friendly, their products fresh, creative and made or grown in Vermont!  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.name: Brattleboro Winter Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.hours: Saturdays November 3 - March 30 10:00am - 2:00pm; 10:00am - 3:00pm during holidays Nov 24-Dec 22
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.description: Fresh local foods ranging from produce, eggs, grass-fed meats to preserved foods, storage crops, syrup, local wine, fresh baked breads and pastries, and much, much more!  We also have an array of artisans selling hand crafted goods ranging from pottery, wood crafts, jewelry to handmade soaps, clothing, and herbal products!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/les.name: Lester Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/les.description: Lester Farm grows a variety of high-quality produce that is picked fresh daily. The 28 acre farm and market is open 7 days a week, and is located just four miles north of Middlebury. Produce includes: sweet corn, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, broccoli, cabbage, cauliflower, squash, eggplant, melons, beets, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, pumpkins, gourds and flowers. Other seasonal and local products are also available at the farm market. Open mid-July through Thanksgiving, mother nature permitting.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pit.name: Pitcher Inn, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pit.hours: Breakfast for inn guests only. Dinner open to public 6:00 until 9:30
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pit.description: The Pitcher Inn and Restaurant is a Relais and Chateaux property located in the picturesque village of Warren, Vermont. The Inn has 11 uniquely appointed rooms with fireplaces, large balconies and private bathrooms with steam showers and Jacuzzi tubs.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.name: Vermont Spirits
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.hours: Wednesday to Monday, 10-5, call for extended summer and fall hours
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.description: Vermont Spirits produces award winning vodkas inspired by sugars from Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/spa.name: Spates Maple
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/spa.hours: The sugarhouse is open during the spring sugaring season from 12:00 to 6:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/spa.description: We have 3,200 taps onsite and haul concentrated sap from 10,500 taps we have in Newport Center.  Pipeline is used on all taps, we have a Reverse Osmosis on site and offsite.  We boil on a 4'x12' oil fired arch, with stainless steel welded pans and storage tanks.  I have sugared since 1975.  We offer syrup for sale and free taste samples are always given.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/und.name: Underhill & Jericho Online Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/und.hours: Pick-up: Thursdays 3-6:30pm at 115 Orr Rd, Jericho and Thursdays 4-7:00pm Jericho & Underhill Center's County Stores

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/riv.name: River Tavern at Hawk Inn & Mountain
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/riv.description: Since its inception over fifteen years ago, The River Tavern Restaurant has developed a reputation for evoking the essence of elegant dining in a casual Vermont atmosphere. Award-winning Chef Marc Scott is acclaimed for his delectable, Regional New American and World Cuisine that blends seasonal and seemingly unlikely ingredients into harmonious combinations that delight both the most discriminating eye and seasoned palate. Fine wines from elite vineyards throughout the globe complement the distinctive presentation of each course.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.name: Burlington Winter Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.description: With the fortune of having so many farms and studios nearby paired with a growing interest in buying locally, the Burlington Winter Farmers’ Market opened in 2008. Inside Burlington’s Memorial Auditorium you can find over 50 vendors offering a surprising array of hardy produce, prepared foods, crafts, and much more. Sheltered from the snowy Vermont weather, this indoor marketplace bustles with locals and visitors every other Saturday from November to April.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cal.name: Caledonia Farmers' Market - Danville
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cal.description: In Danville on the Danville Green, every Wednesday from June through mid October, 9AM to 1PM.  The weekly farmers market is held on Wednesday mornings, rain or shine.  Many local gardeners and farmers will be setup every week with fresh vegetables, most picked that day. Many have signs indicating that their vegetables are organically grown. Others sell donuts and bread that they have made, yarn that they have woven, and goats cheese that they have made, and of course maple syrup. This year the new product is Vermont made wine, you can even sample it before you buy!  New vendors and new shoppers are always welcome, it's worth the drive.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/put.name: Putney Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/put.description: The Putney Farmers' Market is an outdoor Sunday market open from Memorial Day Weekend through Columbus Day Weekend, with winter holiday markets at Green Mountain Orchards. We are a non-profit organization that seeks to support local agriculture and entrepreneurship, while promoting regional sustainability. Every week we host farmers who specialize in diversity, variety and quality. Shop for locally grown produce and region-specific bedding plants; Vermont favorites like cheese and maple syrup; value-added products like jams, pickles and preserves; scrumptious baked goods and rustic pies and tarts. We also feature artisan crafts and handmade goods that are purposeful, practical and beautiful.  Just a short stop off Exit 4 on I-91, we're open rain or shine and have plenty of parking.  Located in the beautiful Community Garden spot in Putney and right across from the Putney Food Co-op. Shop with your EBT or Debit card, we also distribute Harvest Health and accept Farm to Family Coupons.Holiday Market held monthly at Green Mountain Orchards, Putney November through December, 11:00am-2:00pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fou.name: Four Springs Farm, Campground & Learning Center
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fou.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fou.description: Tucked high on a west-facing slope with vistas of the Green Mountains and lovely sunsets, the orchards, greenhouses and vegetable gardens of this multi-faceted organic farm along with pastured poultry dotting the fields, provide a welcoming landscape for visitors who come to Four Springs Farm for rustic camping, volunteering or educational programs.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/but.name: Butternut Mountain Farm Store
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/but.hours: Hours are 9:00am to 5:30pm Monday thru Saturday and 11:00am to 4:00pm on Sunday (except for New Years, Easter, Thanksgiving and Christmas)
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/but.description: Open since 1986, the Butternut Mounatin Farm store, known locally as Marvin's Country Store, is the retail outlet for Butternut Mountain Farm, one of the State's largest processors and distributiors of pure maple syrup.  The store features items made with Butternut Mountain Farm maple syrup and sugar, as well as other Vermont specialties like cheese, honey, jams and Vermont made products.  In addition maple sugaring supplies and equipment from Leader and Maple Pro are available for sale.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.name: Lunchbox Market - Canaan
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.hours: First Monday of the month, 4-6pm; July 1 - October 7
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.description: The Lunchbox is a mobile farmers’ market and commercial kitchen that brings locally grown food and food-based education to communities in northern Vermont. The market’s mission is to improve fresh food access, provide a reliable outlet for new and small scale growers and value-added producers, and to create a gathering place for community activities and meals. We’ll accomplish this by: Visiting sites including senior meal sites and low-income housing sites once per week with fresh produce, dairy, meat, and flour from local farms. We’re looking to expand to prepared food in the Spring. Leading workshops on cooking, food preservation, and other food topics. Creating a vibrant community hub with shared meals, skills, and the arts.Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pen.name: Penny Cluse Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pen.hours: Monday through Friday 6:45 AM - 3:00 PM. Weekends and Holidays 8:00 AM - 3:00 PM.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pen.description: Breakfast and lunch served all day.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sol.name: Solar Sweet Maple Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sol.hours: We are open every day during sugaring season.  During the off season you may email or call us to set up an appointment for a tour or try your luck and we may be there during the off season.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sol.description: Solar Sweet Maple Farm is the first solar powered sugarhouse in Vermont!  We are a self-sustaining and energy efficient sugarhouse powered by a 12.5 kw solar field, heated by wood harvested from our property and constructed of reclaimed timber and wood.  We have 15,000 taps on our 200 acre sugarbush.  our sap is boiled in our wood-fired evaporator to make delicious Vermont maple syrup.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.name: Shearer Hill Farm Bed and Breakfast
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.description: For Every Season There IS a Reason to Visit Shearer Hill Farm B&B.  We want to be your Country home away from home.  Wake to the aroma of freshly brewed coffee, homemade scones, and Baked Apples.  Enjoy the quiet setting on our SMALL WORKING FARM located on a quiet pristine country road.  Wake to the Moooos of our white faced Herford cows.  We are just five miles from the center of Wilmington.  We have large rooms with private baths.  We serve a delicious Vermont Breakfast utilizing some of the delicious Vermont Maple Syrup that is made right here on the farm.  Come in March and April and join us and learn the Maple Sugaring process.  We welcome children.  In the summer we have Marlboro Music Festival just 5 miles away.  We also have swimming, horse back riding, biking and hiking nearby.  In winter enjoy down hill skiing at Mt Snow Ski Resort, cross-country skiing and snowmobiling very close by.  There is nothing as wonderful as renewing your spirit with a "farm stay".

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.name: Storm Cafe, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.hours: Lunch: Monday - Saturday 11:30 - 2:30 Dinner: Tuesday - Sunday 5pm - close
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.description: Innovative American cuisine served on the banks of The Otter Creek.  Enjoy outdoor dining on our deck while tasting our seasonal changing menus using the freshest ingredients!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.name: Woodstock Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.hours: Tuesday-Thursday 7:30am-6pm, Friday and Saturday 7:30am-7pm and Sunday 9am-6pm. We are CLOSED on Mondays.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.description: We are a unique fresh food market.  Since 1992, we are local people serving the local community outstanding home cooking with a twist - Fresh produce, seasonal plants, groceries, coffee, fresh meats and seafood, artisan cheeses, wine, beer, and fresh baked goods.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.name: Hildene Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.description: The barn at Hildene Farm is designed specifically to house Hildene’s herd of Nubian goats and for public viewing of cheese production from milking to small batch processing, pasteurization, aging and packaging of Hildene Farm Artisanal Cheeses. This is a micro operation with our cheesemakers, making and banking cheese year round using cow’s milk from local farms to produce havarti.  After the annual kidding season, production turns to the making of fresh chevre. Goat’s milk havarti is also produced during the spring and summer seasons. The goat farming operation clearly broadens the focus of Hildene, beyond its designation as a historic home, and is now an integral part of the thriving agricultural education component of the institution.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bil.name: Billings Farm & Museum
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bil.hours: May - Oct. 10:00 a.m - 5:00 p.m.; Nov. - Feb. open weekends, Christmas & President weeks, 10:00 a.m. - 3:30 p.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bil.description: Billings Farm & Museum is keeping alive the spirit and values of Vermont's rural past.  The farm dates back to 1871, when native Vermonter, Frederick Billings set out to build a farm and forestry operation that would serve future generations as a model of wise stewardship.  His farm flourished and today is still a first-class working farm, operating with a museum of Vermont's rural heritage.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/man.name: Manchester Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/man.description: Come visit us at our new downtown location.  Over 20 vendors bringing fresh-picked produce, local meats, cheeses, wine, fruit, preserved and prepared foods, alongside quality handcrafts.  Join us Thursdays, rain or shine, 3pm-6pm, June-October at Adam's Park, next to the Chamber of Commerce on Route 7A Manchester Center.  Debit, EBT Farm to Family Coupons Accepted.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bob.name: Bobcat Cafe & Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bob.hours: Bar opens daily at 4pm; Sunday - Thursday 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM; Friday - Saturday 5:00 PM - 9:30 PM
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bob.description: Located at the heart of the Green Mountains, we have the unique pleasure of serving handcrafted beers alongside homemade food that is fresh and creative. Our brewmaster, Mark Magiera, uses high quality grains, hops and yeast strains to create up to a dozen true to style beers. With his unending expertise, Mark is passionate and innovative without losing the tradition behind each style. In the kitchen, we work hard to bring consistency and quality to the table. We focus on local ingredients to enhance our creative comfort food.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.name: Champlain Valley Alpacas and Wedding Barn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.description: We are a family run farm in the beautiful Champlain Valley.  We have been raising alpacas since 1998, and now have added some lovely Hereford and Angus ladies and a two year old Marquette vineyard.  We welcome farm stay guests to our three season private pool cottage, one family at a time. Well behaved dogs and horses may accompany your family.  Enjoy the quiet, interact with the delightful animals, or relax by the pool and catch up on your reading.  Our wedding barn is a lovely and rustic venue for any event.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.name: Middlebury Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.hours: Wednesdays and Saturdays 9:00am-12:30pm; Saturdays: May 4 - October 26; Wednesdays: June 12 - October 9
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.description: The Middlebury Farmers' Market (MFM) is a Wednesday and Saturday outdoor market that operates May through October with about 60 registered vendors in the historic Marble Works section of Middlebury village. It also operates as a winter market November through April inside American Flatbread Restaurant in the Marble Works area.Nearly two-thirds of the vendors sell local agricultural products including vegetables, fruits, plants, flowers, and meat and dairy items. There is also a wide variety of Vermont crafts. MFM is particularly strong in organic and conventional vegetables, organic meats and eggs, and goats and cows milk cheeses.  EBT and Debit accepted!See Middlebury Winter Farmers Market for winter market details.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cro.name: Crowley Cheese
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cro.hours: The Factory is generally open 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday and some Sundays. Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cro.description: Award-winning Crowley Cheese has been made in the Green Mountains of Vermont from the same recipe, in the same manner, since 1824. Hand-made the old-fashioned way, it’s cheese the way it used to be -- all natural, with no additives or preservatives. Pure, simple, delicious: cheese that everyone will love.All-natural Crowley Cheese is made by hand from fresh, whole, unpasteurized milk without additives or preservatives. Our milk comes from cows certified BST and BGH free. With a distinctively smooth, creamy texture, Crowley Cheese is often compared to a cheddar “without the bite.”

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.name: The Jackson House Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.hours: Call 24 hours a day for reservations!
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.description: ocated just outside the heart of Woodstock, Vermont, The Jackson House Inn provides a peaceful alternative to the vibrant village streets. This 19th century Vermont inn offers easy access to popular destinations including Killington and Okemo ski areas, Dartmouth College, and the Green Mountain Horse Association and serves as the perfect setting for your private romantic getaway, intimate Vermont wedding, leisurely vacation, or business retreat.Experience the Vermont foliage season, hike the Appalachian Trail, or cruise Vermont’s newest byway – The Crossroad of Vermont (US Route 4). Savor memorable breakfasts featuring local ingredients, explore three acres of landscaped gardens, and rejuvenate in one of our distinctive rooms or one-room suites.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.name: Stony Brook Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.description: Stony Brook Farm offers country lodging accommodations for parties of up to 6 in a beautifully renovated cottage on the farm. While at the farm guests and visitors can join us for a farmstead tour to meet our friendly animals. We have goats, baby calves, chickens, ducks and geese! Depending on when you come you might be lucky and get a chance to help feed the animals and gather eggs! We also have suggestions for what you can do on your visit whether you join us in winter, summer or fall.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sug.name: Sugarsnap
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sug.hours: Monday through Friday - 10:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.  Catering available seven days a week.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sug.description: Take-out restaurant and catering  company specializing in tasty, wholesome foods.  We also operate a farm in Burlington's Intervale.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cou.name: Courtyard by Marriott- Burlington Harbor
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cou.hours: Breakfast: M-F 6am - 10am Sat & Sun 7am - 11am  Dinner Daily: 5pm - 10pm  Bar Daily: 4pm - 11pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cou.description: The Courtyard Burlington Harbor is Burlington's newest hotel. We have 127 beautifully designed guest rooms, and meeting space able to accommodate up to 125 people, from small meetings to dinner celebrations, we can do it all! We also offer our Hospitality Suite on the 9th floor for meetings and cocktail receptions. This room includes a deck with breathtaking views of Lake Champlain. We serve breakfast daily in the Park cafe, and dinner nightly at our Lounge. Join us every Friday and Saturday night for live music from local musicians!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cro.name: CROP Bistro and Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cro.description: Crop believes in simplicity…..We believe food is at its most flavorful, its most creative, its most passionate, when it’s at its freshest.We believe food is at its best when it highlights the care and craftsmanship of those who bring it from the field to your plate.We believe food is community, a series of connections between farmers and chefs and guests.Seasonal, local flavors, hand-crafted ales and inventive libations, lovingly prepared and cheerfully served…Come and share the bounty of Crop.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bac.name: Backdoor Bakery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bac.description: The Backdoor Bakery is a home-based business located in the shadow of Camels Hump in the lower village of Huntington, VT. From the porch of our 1900s farmhouse, we offer customers a variety of from-scratch baked goods including pastries, breads, and cakes

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/men.name: Mendon Mountain Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/men.description: Mendon Mountain Orchards is not only a charming Vermont motel, but also a working apple orchard. We offer a unique lodging experience, with all the charm of a country inn and the privacy of a motel.  Stroll  through our 28 acre apple orchard that was planted in the late 1920s by Dr. John Thomas, president of Middlebury College back in 1908.We offer a wonderful "Pick Your Own Apples" experience every fall, a beautiful time of year here in Vermont. Check out our orchard store, we have fresh apple cider, delicious homemade pies, world famous turnovers, apple cider vinegar, Vermont products, and of course, apples.Mendon Mountain Orchards and Motel offers affordable accommodations, nestled in our historic apple orchard. But the best part of your stay may be the aroma of homemade apple pies from our bakery and the complimentary coffee and apple turnovers each morning!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/red.name: Red Clover Inn & Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/red.description: Red Clover Inn & Restaurant is best known for its destination-quality cuisine prepared by Chef Dennis Vieira. One of the best places to eat near Killington and Rutland the restaurant features great Vermont-farm-to-table food, casual fine dining, a relaxed, fireside setting, and a small, sociable tavern, plus a sizable wine cellar. The private hill farm setting right near Pico and Killington is perfect for romance, friends, weddings and parties.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lon.name: Long Trail Brewing Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lon.hours: Open daily, 10am to 7pm; pub fare served from 11am to 6pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lon.description: The Long Trail Brewing Company began its mission to brew high quality craft beer in November 1989. A humble beginning in the basement of the old Bridgewater Woolen Mill along the Ottauquechee River in the Green Mountains of Vermont was soon outgrown so the brewery packed up and “Hit the Trail” up the road to a riverside hay field where they now reside in a state of the art, environmentally friendly brewery. Now, thousands of visitors every year experience Long Trail’s hospitality and unique country ambience while enjoying great food, fresh brews and an intimate view of the brewing process at the brewery’s Visitor Center.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kit.name: Kitchen Table Bistro, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kit.hours: Closed: Sundays and Mondays Open: Tuesday - Saturday: 5:00PM - 8:30PM
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kit.description: A chef owned restaurant featuring quality ingredients and seasonal flavors. An inviting, comfortable bistro with great food and wine in a historic 1795 brick farm house.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/and.name: Andrie Rose Inn, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/and.hours: Dinner by Reservation Friday & Saturday Nights.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/and.description: Built in 1829, our bed and breakfast in Vermont is located at the base of Okemo Mountain on a quiet village street. We offer a romantic getaway for the most discerning traveler. We also offer a well kept room with all of the essentials for your stay, homemade meals, privacy and one of the most gorgeous views. What more could you possibly ask for? With a limited number of spaces, you are guaranteed your privacy and the quiet you’ve been looking for. The Andrie Rose Inn also features a chef owned & operated fine dining restaurant with a seasonally changing menu.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cor.name: Cortland Hill Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cor.hours: Open mid-August through mid-November please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cor.description: Cortland Hill Orchard offers peaches, plums, apples, a farm stand, and PYO (apples).

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.name: Kingdom Brewing
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.description: Kingdom Brewing is located high atop Coburn Hill in the town of Newpoer Center, just a half mile past the northern most point of Route 100 on 105 East. The northern most point of Route 100 can be found about 4 miles southwest of Lake Memphremagog.Brian and Jenn Cook created Kingdom Brewing with the intent to brew terrific craft beers from a wide variety of locally produced ingredients.  Starting with American grown grains, they add locally produced ingredients such as maple sap, spruce tips or apples to create a variety of light to robust seasonal beers.In addition to their homegrown philosophy, the Cooks run Kingdom Brewing in the most environmentally friendly way possible. One common problem for many brewers is finding a way to dispose of the mash left over from the brewing process. The Black Angus beef herd on the Cook’s farm happily dispose of the spent grains for them. Additionally, the brewery uses a geo-thermal type of fermentation cooling system.See what’s brewing on Facebook!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/far.name: Farmhouse Inn at Robinson Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/far.description: Enjoy Vermont as you have imagined it with a memorable countryside bed and breakfast stay at the Farmhouse Inn at Robinson Farm in quintessentially beautiful Woodstock, Vermont. The open farmland setting is spectacular, the beds are comfortable, the hospitality is friendly, and candle-lit breakfasts will be hot, hearty, and homemade using locally sourced products including fresh eggs that we collect daily from our happy hens and featuring our homemade maple syrup and garden delights.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lau.name: Laughing Moon Chocolates
