http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lau.description: Laughing Moon Chocolates provides hand made chocolates in Stowe and Waterbury they are committed to social responsibility, environmental stewardship and to creating a healthy local food system.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.name: The Alchemist
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.hours: Tasting Room and Retail Shop are open Monday - Saturday 11:00am-7:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.description: The Alchemist is a small, family run brewery specializing in fresh, unfiltered IPA.  We are currently focused on brewing one beer perfectly – Heady Topper, an American Double IPA.  In early 2011 we built the Alchemist Cannery, a 15 barrel brewery and canning line, for the production of our flagship IPA.  The first cans of Heady Topper rolled off the line just two days after Tropical Storm Irene demolished The Alchemist Pub and Brewery.Today we brew 120 barrels per week in eight 15 barrel batches.  We never hold back inventory, and we move all of our beer weekly in a concerted effort to provide the freshest, hoppiest packaged IPA on the market.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bai.name: Bailey's Restaurant at Bolton Valley Resort
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bai.hours: The Tavern is open for food from 11am-9pm Sunday- Thursday and 11am-10pm Friday - Saturday all season long.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bai.description: Located on the top floor of the Base Lodge, our cozy Pub offers a great view, a warm fireplace, and live entertainment (on Thursdays and Saturdays.)  The bar serves a variety of 18 beers on tap--mostly local brews. Hoist a pint of Imperial Guinness, or sample our Moose Madness Ale. Chase away winter’s chill with a “Dutch Chocolate” (Vandermint Chocolate Mint Liqueur mixed with Hot Chocolate.)  Try one of our signature soups, our in-demand VT local beef burger, or any of our ever evolving specials. The Bar is usually open at least an hour later than food service.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gar.name: Garden Cafe and Gallery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gar.hours: Open Friday-Monday, serving dinner 5:30-close. Serving Brunch on Sunday from 11:30am—2pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gar.description: For over 30 years, visitors to Southern Vermont have gone out of their way to stop for a meal at the Garden. Chef-owner Judith Platt has established a reputation as one of the finest culinary imaginations in the region. Her menus are influenced by the pure and subtle flavors of Europe and Asia , and every meal is a feast for the eyes, served on antique plates and garnished with edible flowers. Whether you enjoy her winter menus with the finest cuts of beef and seafood prepared to perfection or you arrive in the summer months to experience her tasting menu—with five courses, each one topping the last—you are assured a dining experience you will never forget.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bry.name: Bryant House Restaurant at the Vermont Country Store
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bry.hours: Breakfast: Saturday 8:00am - 11:00am; Brunch: Sunday 9:00am - 3:30pm; Lunch: Monday - Saturday 11:00am - 3:30pm; Dinner: Thursday - Saturday  3:30pm - 9:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bry.description: Enjoy a sit-down meal in the charming 1827 eating rooms of our remodeled Bryant House Restaurant in Weston. We serve a wide variety of hearty comfort-food dishes-such as our homemade Bryant House Chicken Pie-as well as soups, sandwiches, lighter fare... and, of course, real Vermont cheddar. Specials change daily. Enjoy a libation and appetizer in our beautiful 1885 barroom. Treat yourself to one of our scrumptious desserts made from scratch. Bring the whole family! Your children will find their favorites on our Little People's Menu. Located right next door to The Vermont Country Store.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.name: Brattleboro Area Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.hours: May  5 - Oct 26: Saturdays 9am-2pm Route 9 near the Covered Bridge; Wednesdays (June 5 - October 30) 10am-2pm Brattleboro Co-op
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.description: The Brattleboro Area Farmers' Market is Southern Vermont's premier farmers' market featuring over 50 vendors with agricultural products, crafts, live music and animals and ethnic foods from around the world. Whether you are local or a tourist, you can stop by to get your weekly produce and grab a quick lunch, or come with your family and stay for the day!  EBT and Debit Accepted!Saturday Market runs May 5 - October 26 at Rte 9 near the covered bridge.Wednesday Market runs June 5 - October 30 at Brattleboro Food Co-op.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.name: Boyden Farm, LLC
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.description: Boyden Farm beef is a healthy, natural alternative to industrially-raised meats. The Farm raises all its own feed -- corn and soy silage, hay, and pasture grasses. We use no hormones or feed antibiotics. Our animals are cared for naturally at their own growth rate.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.name: Grafton Village Cheese Company - Grafton
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.description: We have relocated our retail shop in Grafton, so we now have a brand new Specialty Cheese & Wine Shop in the heart of historic Grafton village, right next to the Grafton Inn. Viewing cheesemaking can be done at our production facility on 533 Townshend Road on select days. Our retail shop will have the most updated schedule.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.name: Gray Ghost Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.description: We are a family owned and operated bed and breakfast located on picturesque Route 100 in Southern Vermont. We are less than a mile from the slopes of Mount Snow and fewer than 20 minutes to Stratton.Full Vermont breakfast cooked to order and served with a smile is always included. We pride ourselves on using only locally sourced eggs, Vermont maple syrup, organic sausages and bacon which is dry cured and smoked in Vermont. By buying local products we are trying to do our part to ensure great tasting breakfast and a healthy Vermont economy.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.name: Harpoon Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.hours: Sunday - Wednesday: 10 AM to 6 PM; Thursday - Saturday: 10 AM to 9 PM
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.description: Step up to the counter and order yourself a fresh pint of Harpoon beer along with a delicious sandwich in our unique brewery setting. Seating is available inside the brewery overlooking our bottling line, or outside in our outdoor Beer Garden area. Not sure which beer you would like to try? Don't worry, you can purchase our popular sample tray which features five 5 ounce samples of fresh Harpoon beer on tap.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sco.name: Scott Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sco.hours: Open seven days a week during apple harvest from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Classes & Workshops, Inns & B&B's
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sco.description: Scott Farm produces 90 varieties of ecologically grown apples - heirloom apples such as Roxbury Russet, Belle de Boskoop, and Cox’s Orange Pippin and unusual apples like Winter Banana and Hidden Rose - some of the finest in color, texture, and taste. Other fine fruits include quince, gooseberries, medlars, Asian pears, plums, raspberries, elderberries, table grapes, pears, blueberries, nectarines, and peaches.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jay.name: Jay Peak Resort-Tram Haus Lodge & Alice's Table
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jay.description: As part of Jay Peak's expansion project the newest accommodations at Jay Peak Resort, the Tram Haus Lodge, includes 57 studio, 1-, 2-, and 3- bedroom suites and is located directly slopeside a mere few steps from the Tram and Flyer Quad. The hotel includes a cafe (Aroma), bar (Tower Bar), and restaurant with Farm to Table menu (Alice's Table).

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/twi.name: Twin Farms
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/twi.description: Steeped in romance and folklore, Twin Farms is Vermont’s only luxury, five-star experience. With a sophisticated yet eccentric private art collection throughout 20 uniquely-designed accommodations ensconced in 300 acres, Twin Farms customizes every detail. Indulge in gourmet meals and fine wine. Pursue outdoor adventures. Retreat and relax. Engage in serious, contemplative work. Reconnect with people you love. Inspire yourself with possibilities.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/whe.name: Whetstone Station Restaurant and Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/whe.description: Our very own in-house nano-brewery produces 3.5BBL (about 6 kegs) of beer centric goodness at a time.  We tap one of our own beers at a time, always on tap #1, and shake up the variety and styles regularly.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cli.name: Cliff House at Stowe Mountain Resort
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cli.description: Distinctively situated on the shoulder of Mount Mansfield, the Cliff House brings fine dining to new heights.  The rustic interior pays homage to the Austrian roots of our chalet with spectacular panoramic-view seating and floor-to-ceiling windows that frame the surrounding alpine peaks.  From our open kitchen Chef Matthew Reeve serves up regional American cuisine with a rustic Vermont flair. Our commitment to using the freshest seasonal and artisan ingredients can be tasted in every mouth-watering dish and sinful dessert; and our hand-selected wine list and tantalizing cocktails will complement any meal.  Reservations are not taken for lunch.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.name: Three Penny Taproom
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.hours: Food service open Monday through Saturday, 11-9pm, and Sunday 10-4 serving the brunch menu
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/thr.description: At Three Penny Taproom, we illustrate the harmony of flavor inherent in the pairing of honest food with honest beer. The beer we serve is chosen for the artistry and care which the brewers demonstrate in their exceptional products. It will come as no surprise that our food program reflects this mastery of craft and honor for tradition. Craft food for craft beer.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jed.name: Jed's Maple Products
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jed.hours: Monday - Friday 8am - 4pm; Saturday 10am - 4pm  Open year round, sugarhouse tours in the spring.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jed.description: Nestled in the heart of Vermont's Northeast Kingdom, Jed's Maple Products is excited to welcome you.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.name: Grand View Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.hours: Open 11am to 5pm daily late May until late October
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gra.description: Grand View Winery is a family owned farm winery producing exceptional grape wines and wines from fruits that grow easily and naturally in Vermont. In addition to using fruits from our own orchards and groves, we support other Vermont farms and orchards by purchasing their fruits. We use organically grown produce whenever possible.Over the seventeen years that we have been producing wine, our wines have won regional, national and international awards. While focusing on fruits that grow easily in Vermont, we produce wines that are not overly sweet.  Limiting the sweetness brings out more of the natural flavors of the fruit. All wines are allowed to age at least nine months before bottling. Our Grape wines are often aged one to two years. We use no oak barrels or oak chips to avoid masking the true flavors.  The one exception to our production of fruit wines which are not overly sweet is our new Pear Ice Wine.  Like any ice wine the intenseness of the fruit is brought out in the natural freezing process, resulting in a delightful sweet dessert wine.Spring, summer and fall come off the beaten path. Enjoy our rural setting with 50-mile views. Bring a lunch to enjoy with a selected wine while sitting outside soaking up the views, flower gardens and tranquility.Or visit our Retail Shop and Tasting Room on Route 100, Waterbury Center, at the Cold Hollow Cider Mill. Open 7 days a week all year round.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/blu.name: Blue Ledge Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/blu.hours: Cheese available for purchase, Mondays & Fridays 8-noon at the farm. Tours welcome by appointment or Mon and Fri 8-noon.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/blu.description: Established in 2000, we are a seasonal goat dairy and cheesemaking operation. We produce nine types of goat and cow cheeses, from very fresh chevres, to semi-aged bloomy rind, to harder aged cheeses, all ripened in our underground caves.  We offer a self-guided tour map. Tours of our painting studio available by appointment (www.blueledgegallery.com)

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bla.name: Black Watch Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bla.description: Black Watch Farm's natural beef comes from animals born and raised on our Vermont farm. All animals are grown without hormonal implants, digestive stimulants and are all grass fed. They are finished on steamed corn the last forty five days. Beef is processed at a USDA facility and packaged in airtight cryovak containers for maximum freshness. Natural casings frank's (no nitrates or nitrites added).

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ede.name: Eden Ice Cider Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ede.hours: We're open to visitors by appointment.  Please make an appointment for a tasting.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ede.description: Boutique winery in the heart of the Northeast Kingdom of Vermont. Focusing on artisanal drinks that reflect the heritage and climate of this beautiful region. Making elegant, gold-medal winning ice ciders and herb-infused aperitif ciders in limited quantities for adventurous wine drinkers, creative chefs, confident sommeliers and inspired bartenders.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.name: Vermont Butter and Cheese Creamery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.description: Launched in 1984, Vermont Butter & Cheese Creamery follows the path Bob and Allison took years ago — crafting artisanal dairy products in the European style through a vital link with local farms. Based in the town of Websterville, the company supports a network of more than 20 family farms, providing milk meeting the highest standards of purity. While Vermont Butter & Cheese Creamery has earned worldwide recognition, the company is proudest of its contribution to the health of local agriculture. After all, as Allison learned on a family farm in France, quality originates at the source — with the people who work the land and the pride they take in the yield.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fra.name: Fradette's Maple Syrup
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fra.hours: 8am to 8pm - Spring, any time during sugaring season.  Summer, Fall, Winter by appointment
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fra.description: Home of Fradette's Pure Vermont Maple Syrup at farm prices.  Our syrup is completely natural and lead free, containing no additives or preservatives. Vistors are welcome to stop in during the sugaring season to experience the Vermont tradition of boiling sap into syrup.  As a special treat we often serve sugar on snow to our visitors.  Our products are available year round and tours during off season by appointment.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.name: Burlington Summer Farmers  Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.address: City Hall Park (corner of College Street & St. Paul Street)
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.description: The Burlington Farmers’ Market provides a welcoming venue for visitors and locals alike to shop directly from Vermont farmers and artisans in the city’s historic downtown. This fun and festive experience is offered year-round through two markets, an outdoor market in warmer months and an indoor market during Vermont’s chilly winters. Both treat shoppers to a bounty of fresh, locally grown produce, handmade crafts, sweet and savory treats, and meats and cheeses from Vermont’s lush pastures.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lit.name: Little Charlie's Sugarbush
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lit.description: Little Charlie's Sugarbush is situated high on a hillside just north of Jay Peak Resort.  We tap approximately 12,000 trees and can produce up to 4500 gallons of pure maple syrup each spring.  Visitors can visit our sugar house by proceeding up the Westover Rd. in Jay then take a right onto an unnamed dirt road at the end.  Our sugar house is approximately 1/2 mile from the turn.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/neb.name: Nebraska Knoll Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/neb.hours: 10:00am til 5:00pm daily.  Personal tours by appointment.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/neb.description: For more than thirty years our family has tapped trees in Nebraska Valley, one ridge over from Mt. Mansfield. The old and the new fuse in our 9800 tap operation; a modern sap-collection system feeds a wood-fired evaporator with open, steamy pans stoked by a crew of neighbors. We sell maple syrup, cream, and candies.  FOUR-WHEEL DRIVE ONLY IN WINTER.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.name: Kingdom Creamery of Vermont
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.description: Start-up ice cream, soft serve mix and yogurt producer. On-farm value-added 3rd generation family farm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tay.name: Taylor Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tay.description: Taylor Farm is a 180 year old working dairy farm nestled in the Green Mountains of southern Vermont.  Our family has operated the farm for the past 20 years.  Our herd consists of 50 milking Holstein and Jersey cows, each individually named and lovingly cared for in a free stall barn, as well as goats, pigs, fowl and our Belgian horses.  Over the years we have added a cheese making facility, lodging, a farm stand, sleigh rides and educational activities.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/51-.name: 51 Main At The Bridge
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/51-.hours: Open 5pm - Late Tuesday thru Saturday. Food until 9pm Tuesday & Wednesday, 10pm Thursday thru Saturday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/51-.description: 51 Main at the Bridge was born from an idea that a group of Middlebury College students had for improving social life at the College. They envisioned a sophisticated, international social space where people of all ages and all walks of life could come together for conversation, good music and art, and with a feeling that was separate from the College.The name was created to not only speak to our geography – at the end of the bridge – but also to speak of the place as a bridge between town and college, a bridge for artists, both musical and visual, to present their talents to the public and a bridge for personal growth through shared experiences.51 Main is open to all who want to experience the beautiful setting, great food with an international flair and music and art that changes in style and presentation regularly. Live music is available nearly every evening Thursday – Saturday. Our mission is to attract many different musical genres, never falling into a niche by type of music. Art exhibits include young artists as well as professional artists with exhibits changing regularly. We pride ourselves on the diversity of food, drink, music and art.51 Main at the Bridge is informal yet sophisticated. It is open to all ages and families are encouraged to come and share the fun together. No reservations are required and there is never a cover charge.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.name: The Heart of the Village Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.hours: Please call ahead for reservations and availability!
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/the.description: Located in the historic village of Shelburne (ten minutes away from downtown Burlington), our freshly re-decorated Victorian Inn features nine guest bedrooms with private bath. Home-baked afternoon treats and delicious Vermont made breakfasts included. Walking distance to Shelburne museum, restaurants, art galleries, and book, toy, and coffee shops. Our welcoming environment is perfect for leisure and business travel, family gatherings, and small meetings.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mag.name: Magnolia Breakfast & Lunch Bistro
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mag.hours: Mon - Fri: 7:00 am-3:00 pm     Sat - Sun:	8:00 am	-3:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mag.description: Breakfast and lunch with a twist! Magnolia Bistro offers non-traditional takes on traditional dishes while using the finest local and organic ingredients whenever possible.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green Mountain Sugar House
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: The Green Mountain Sugar House is open daily 9am to 6pm, year round.  Our sugarhouse is open for viewing and to learn about the process of making maple syrup.  We produce and sell our maple syrup, maple products, along with many other Vermont food products and gifts.  All seasons are a great time to visit, each one has something different to offer.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roc.name: Rock Art Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roc.hours: Monday-Saturday 9:00-6:00; TOURS 2:00pm and 4:00pm daily and an additional tour at 11:00am on Saturday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roc.description: Rock Art opened its new facility during the spring of 2011 and is welcoming customers for tastings, tours and the best selection of Rock Art beer available.  We are also offering select Vermont cheeses, as well as other Vermont crafted foods and items.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/qui.name: Quimby Country
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/qui.hours: Mon. - Sun.: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM for reservations
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/qui.description: Nestled in the heart of Vermont's Northeast Kingdom sits a family resort with more than 100 years of bringing generations together, a place called Quimby's. Situated on 1,000 acres of Great North Woods Forest, Quimby's offers something for everyone who is interested in stepping into a quieter place where nature beckons with opportunities for active and restful activities alike.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/smo.name: Smokeshire Hilltop Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/smo.hours: Please call ahead to plan a visit!
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/smo.description: Smokeshire Hilltop Farm is a traditional Vermont hill farm, sustainably powered by a balance of new and old technology. The farm and forestry are horse and biodiesel powered. We produce five varieties of raspberries starting in July through October; three varieties of blueberries, raw wildflower honey, lamb and firewood. Our berries are available as “pick your own”. Our lamb is grass fed humanely slaughtered, available custom cut, USDA inspected.   Forest restoration and custom farm services are done using Suffolk Draft Horses, a heritage breed. We are also available for hay rides and, in the winter “Extreme” sleigh rides (4 person maximum) - Try it! Visitors are always welcome! - Call or e-mail for information!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.name: Woodcock Farm Cheese Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.hours: Please call ahead to schedule a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.description: For centuries, the Europeans have enjoyed the distinctive flavor of cheeses made from sheep's milk. In fact, more sheep are milked than any other animal worldwide, and some of the world's best cheeses - like Roquefort, Manchego, and Pecorino Romano - are made from the milk of sheep, not cows or goats. The making of sheep's milk cheese migrated to the United States only within the last 25 years, with Vermont farms being the most dedicated crafters. Vermont has earned a reputation for its award-winning cheeses, commitment to all-natural foods, and dogged pursuit of quality. Put these three factors together and you describe the Woodcock Farm Cheese Company. Situated just outside the historic village of Weston in the Green Mountains of Vermont, cheesemakers Mark and Gari Fischer have crafted a select variety of artisanal cheese from farm-fresh sheep's milk. We pride ourselves on the flavor and texture of the cheeses we lovingly create and tend throughout the year.In keeping with the age-old tradition, our flock of East Friesian sheep - a breed highly regarded by cheesemakers - graze on 45 acres of lush organic pastures. This healthy diet gives the cheese its rich, buttery flavor. We collect the milk in the morning and add rennet to produce the curds, which form the basis for the many types of cheese produced here at Woodcock Farm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fle.name: Fletcher Allen Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fle.description: Farmers Market held In the Davis Concourse of the hospital.  Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jef.name: Jeffersonville Farmers' and Artisan Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jef.description: The Jeffersonville Farmers' and Artisan Market is a community effort to unite local producers with the greater community. The goal is to build community through great food, music, art, and special event activities for children and adults.   Enjoy live music at the Market!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/smi.name: Smith Maple Crest Farm LLC
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/smi.hours: Please call ahead for reservations and tour
categories: Maple Syrup, Inns & B&B's, Farm Visits
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/smi.description: Our 8th generation totals 204 years of producing award winning maple syrup. As we are a working farm and B&B please call ahead for reservations and tour.  Retrace Robert Frost's footsteps while enjoying our wonderful mountain view.  Maple products and our own grass fed beef available for purchase.We are a proud participant in the VT Maple Open House Weekend.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mic.name: Michael's on the Hill
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mic.hours: Dinner: 5:30 pm - 9:00 pm.  Closed on Tuesday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mic.description: Innovative European fine dining in a circa 1820 farmhouse. Focusing on local ingredients, using all the best the season has to offer. Prepared by Swiss chef/owner Michael Kloeti.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.name: Lunchbox Market - North Troy
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.description: The Lunchbox is a mobile farmers’ market and commercial kitchen that brings locally grown food and food-based education to communities in northern Vermont. The market’s mission is to improve fresh food access, provide a reliable outlet for new and small scale growers and value-added producers, and to create a gathering place for community activities and meals. We’ll accomplish this by: Visiting sites including senior meal sites and low-income housing sites once per week with fresh produce, dairy, meat, and flour from local farms. We’re looking to expand to prepared food in the Spring. Leading workshops on cooking, food preservation, and other food topics. Creating a vibrant community hub with shared meals, skills, and the arts.Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ked.name: Kedron Valley Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ked.description: One of Vermont's oldest inns, the Kedron Valley Inn has welcomed visitors to South Woodstock, VT, for more than 185 years.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.name: Middlebury Winter Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.hours: Saturdays in Nov & Dec, March & April, 9:30am-1:00pm; No market held Jan. and Feb. 2013.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.description: Local produce, meats, cheese and eggs, baked goods, jams, prepared foods and crafts. EBT and debit cards welcome.See Middlebury Farmers Market for summer market details.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gro.name: Groton Growers Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gro.hours: May 26 - September 29: Summer hours 10:00am-1:00pm; Winter hours 10:00am-2:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gro.description: Every Saturday, May  - Oct., 10:00 - 1:00 on the Community Building Lawn in Groton.  Locally grown fresh produce, meats, fruits, maple syrup, baked goods, handcrafts, ...... and more.  Come and have coffee and lunch!  Debit and EBT Accepted.Winter market meets at the Gym at Groton Community Building monthly from October - April every third Saturday from 10:00am-2:00pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bea.name: Beaver Pond Farm Inn B&B
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bea.description: Nestled in the Green Mountains and minutes to some of the best skiing Vermont has to offer, you will find a distinctive and intimate Bed and Breakfast. Let the glorious views, lush landscape and historic charm of our 1840's farmhouse rejuvenate your spirit. Skillfully prepared breakfasts and treats, the caress of fine linens and warm crackling fires are sure to leave you feeling pampered.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.name: Chef's Corner Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.hours: Mon: 7:30 am-4:00pm; Fri: 7:30am-5:00pm Sat - Sun:8:00am-4:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.description: Chef's Corner is a family owned, 80 seat cafe with a warm, friendly feel that supports local vendors. Offering breakfast, lunch, weekend brunch, catering, pastries, deli salads, wedding cakes and evening private parties.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hac.name: Hackett's Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hac.description: A family owned and diversified farm and farm market in South Hero with 47 varieties of apples. Enjoy our own cider donuts, apple crisp and freshly pressed sweet cider. Find great local products in our farm market including Vermont maple syrup and honey, jams and jellies, yellow eye beans, Cabot cheese and a wide selection of cookbooks. Fresh vegetables and fruit in season, pumpkins and gourds in the fall. Spend some time enjoying our large picnic and play area. Scheduled wagon rides and orchard tours are available.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/3-s.name: 3 Squares Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/3-s.hours: 8 AM - 8 PM Monday - Saturday, 8 AM - 7 PM Sunday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/3-s.description: Creative, casual fare for the entire family. We proudly offer local and homemade products featuring locally-roasted coffee and espresso, fresh baked muffins and scones, decadent brownies, tasty soups, artisan cheeses, and unique local retail products. Selection of beers and wine available.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.name: Maple Meadow Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.hours: Store Hours  Monday - Friday: 8 AM to 4:30 PM Saturday: 8 AM to Noon
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.description: The Devoid Family at Maple Meadow Farm have been producing and delivering Farm Fresh Eggs and Maple Syrup throughout central and southern Vermont since 1946.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: Norwich Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: The Norwich Inn is a historic 27 guest room inn in the town of Norwich, VT.  Our dining room serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner Tuesday through Sunday with a Sunday Brunch as well.  Jasper Murdock's Alehouse offers a lite fare menu along with our home brewed English Ales.  Both dining options are unique to each other but both offering amazing menus.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nec.name: NECI on Main
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nec.description: Speed, timing and efficiency are essential skills for cooking "on the line" at America's best restaurants. Our future celebrity chefs master the skill of cooking under pressure here for both lunch and dinner. Watch them at work in the kitchen as they master the classic techniques of braising, roasting, sautéing, and frying under the watchful eyes of their dedicated chef instructors. Meet students from all over the world at lunch, where they practice the fine art of table service. At Sunday brunch, the garde manger class will wow you with the art of the "cold kitchen" -- an outrageous feast for both the eye and the palate, featuring house-smoked sausages, meats and fish and the handmade pates of European charcuterie.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hav.name: Havoc Hill Sugarhouse
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hav.hours: Call ahead for tours and purchasing maple syrup
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hav.description: 4800 tap high tech sugarhouse producing award winning Vermont maple syrup of all grades.  Retail, Wholesale and shipping available.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/per.name: Perfect Wife Restaurant & Tavern, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/per.hours: Tavern opens at 4:00 p.m. Dining room opens 5:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.  Closed on Mondays
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/per.description: Happening tavern upstairs, gracious garden dining downstairs. Chef Amy's freestyle cuisine incorporates flavors of the world with a personal flair.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.name: Burlington New North End Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.description: For 2013 we will again be at the Elks Lodge at 925 North Avenue. Find our vendors right off the parking lot in the back!  The market is on Thursdays.  We offer produce, baked goods, prepared foods and meat/eggs.  The market has been in existence for over 10 years.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mer.name: Merck Forest and Farmland Center
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mer.hours: Grounds are open year-round from dawn to dusk; Visitor Center is open 9am - 4pm daily, except for Christmas Day, New Years Day, Easter, and Thanksgiving.
categories: Maple Syrup, Farm Visits, Classes & Workshops
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mer.description: Merck Forest and Farmland Center is an educational nonprofit organization that strives to teach, demonstrate, and sustain a working landscape through sustainable methods.  42 acres of MFFC's 3,100 acre managed forest are part of the certified organic sugaring operation, and the 62 acre farm raises pastured pork and lamb, you-pick berries, potatoes, garlic, and assorted seasonal vegetables.  This summer, stop by for Farm Chores: Summer Series and check out the new grazing garden.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ost.name: Osteria Pane e Salute
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ost.hours: Dinner only  Thursday-Sunday. Closed November and April. Reservations Reccomended.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ost.description: A small, traditional restaurant serving Italian wines with a coffee bar and take-away bakery. Combing Italy for rare and traditional recipes, husband and wife Caleb Barber and Deirdre Heekin bring the flavors and styles of many regions to their charming Osteria.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.name: Wood Roan Bison Ranch
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.description: Here at the Wood Roan Bison Ranch is the home of Sparky and Lucky, 2 orphans from Texas we hauled up 2 years ago. As well as our small herd of Bison we have some very nice Vermont maple (wood-fired) syrup, gathered the ole fashion way with buckets.  We also have fresh Jersey milk to make your own cheese, butter, yogurts. Fresh free range eggs, different egg layers, with beautiful colors.  Also we make jams and jellies and have fresh homemade, all natural unsalted butter.  We ship maple syrup and jams.  Stop in, say hello and get pictures of our Bison.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wes.name: West Swanton Orchard and Cider Mill
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wes.description: West Swanton Orchards and Cider Mill offers apples, fresh apple cider, Vermont specialty food products and gifts, pick-your-own apples and orchard tours in season.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/la-.name: La Brioche
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/la-.hours: Monday - Friday: 6:30am to 5:00pm Saturday: 7:00am to 5:00pm Sunday: 8:00am-2:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/la-.description: NECI's Bakery, La Brioche, awaits you in downtown Montpelier. Arrive early to this European-style bakery and café for a feast of freshly-baked pastries from our culinary arts and baking and pastry students. Our students’ days begin at 4 am to prepare these handmade delights. Artisan breads emerge out of the oven around 11 am and our weekday lunch features fresh sandwiches, soup and salad.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ame.name: American Flatbread- Middlebury Hearth
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ame.hours: Bakery: Monday - Thursday 7:00 am - 3:00 pm.  Restaurant: Friday and Saturday evenings 5:00 pm - 9:30 pm at the Marble Works in Middlebury.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ame.description: Seating is in the oven room where guests can see the fire and watch each flatbread prepared to order. American Flatbreads are also available frozen in grocery stores. "As tasty as pizzas are, half the fun at Flatbread is watching it all unfold" - Burlington Free Press '03.  Visit our bakery Monday - Thursday.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bri.name: Bristol Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bri.hours: June 1 - October 5: Saturdays 10:00am-1:00pm; May 8 - October 2: Wednesdays 3:00pm-6:00pm (starting at the High School, moving to the Green when school is out)
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bri.description: The Bristol Farmers Market, established 15 years ago, has progressed into a full-fledged market, offering a range of activities for community members of all ages.  Its mission states “It is the purpose of the Bristol Farmers’ Market to provide an outlet for local people to sell their farmed goods, prepared foods, crafts and services, while providing area residents with convenient access to a variety of local products in a festive, family-friendly community atmosphere.”  This really says it all, as each week, this market draws in customers from all over in celebration of community and local food.  Visit us on Facebook! EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.name: Wilburton Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.description: The Wilburton Inn is a hilltop historic estate with spectacular views, wonderful dining and large comfortable lodging rooms. We specialize in weddings, family events and romantic vacations.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/res.name: Reservoir Restaurant & Tap Room, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/res.description: The Reservoir is a 99 seat restaurant serving dinner 7 days a week and lunch Friday, Saturday & Sunday.  Located in the heart of downtown Waterbury situated in the beautiful green mountains of Vermont.  We specialize in Vermont comfort food and some of the best beers available.  Currently we have 37 draft beers (the most in the state) as well as a full bar and wine list.  We also have live entertainment every week featuring some of the best artists around.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: Norris Berry Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.hours: Open daily May through October 31st, please call for hours.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: A retail and wholesale berry farm featuring strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries. They also carry pumpkins and vegetables.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hin.name: Hinesburgh Public House
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hin.hours: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm Sun: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hin.description: A community supported restaurant serving locally grown, made-from-scratch delicious food.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tow.name: Townshend Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tow.description: A wonderful weekly farmers' market on the lawn behind the historic West Townshend Country Store at the intersection of Rt. 30 and Windham Hill Rd.  Visitors will find the best of Vermont's harvest - fresh seasonal veggies, fruits, eggs, grass-fed meats, syrup, honey, and plants, along with fresh baked goods, handmade soaps, hand blown glass, tasty dinner offerings and more.  Open rain or shine Fridays from 4-7 pm.  For more information call 802-869-2141, find us on the web or like us on Facebook!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wal.name: Walloomsac Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wal.hours: May 4 - October 26: Tuesdays 3:00pm-6:00pm; June 4 - October 1: Saturdays 10:00am-1:00pm; Winter season: November - April: Third Saturday of the month 10:00am-2:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wal.description: Join us for the Walloomsac Farmers’ Market,  Bennington’s year-round farmers’ market. The market takes place at the scenic Bennington Station at Riverwalk Park along the Walloomsac River on Depot Street on Saturday mornings from 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM.    Tuesday markets will begin in June and take place from 3:00 PM – 6:00 PM at Greenberg and Sons, 321 Main Street, Bennington.Fresh greens, root vegetables, delicious baked goods, dairy products, meats, crafts and more!  All produced locally!The Saturday morning markets are a great way to gather with friends and neighbors and shop for tantalizingly fresh food. Stroll along the river walk, chat with the vendors about their wares, take in the colors and aromas of just-picked vegetables and fresh baked goodies, watch local chefs prepare their favorite dishes using seasonal produce, and enjoy the great sounds of local musicians.  We are introducing informative demonstrations that will take place at least once a month such as How to Make Strawberry Jam, Cooking with Garlic Scapes, Pickle Making and more!  Sign up for our weekly newsletter to find out about all our special events as well as what goods will be offered each week by our vendors.  You can also get a complete schedule on our Music and Events page.This year, the Tuesday market will be located in a convenient downtown location at 321 Main Street so that you can easily stop by and do your midweek shopping.EBT and Debit accepted!Winter market held monthly at the First Episcopal Church, Pleasant & School St., Bennington, October through December 4:00pm-7:00pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.name: Shelburne Farms
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.hours: SUMMER HOURS (mid May - mid Oct): 9:00am-5:30pm; WINTER HOURS (mid October - mid May): 10:00am -5:00pm.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.description: Shelburne Farms is a 1,400-acre working farm, National Historic Landmark and nonprofit environmental education organization whose mission is to cultivate a conservation ethic for a sustainable future.  This is accomplished by teaching and demonstrating the stewardship of natural and agricultural resources. Shelburne Farms produces farmhouse cheddar cheese from the milk of our own Brown Swiss Cows; award-winning farmhouse cheddar cheese aged six-months (mild), one-year (sharp), two-years (extra sharp) and smoked.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roy.name: Roy's Maples
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roy.hours: Call ahead to be sure we are boiling during sugaring season
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/roy.description: Roy's Maples is a family business located in northern VT near the Canadian border.  We began sugaring in 1959 and now it involves three generations.  We boil the sap from our 4,500 taps with a wood fired evaporator. Our syrup is certified organic.  At the 2011 annual Vermont Farm Show in Barre we were awarded the "Best of Show" for our Grade A Medium Amber maple syrup.  We have syrup for sale throughout the year and will ship anywhere.  Visitors are welcome during sugaring season. You can call ahead to be sure we are boiling.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lew.name: Lewis Creek Farm LLC
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lew.hours: Our farm stand is open daily from 8-6 May through November.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lew.description: Lewis Creek Farm has been a leader in sustainable farming since 1981, growing 60 acres of vegetables, herbs, fruits and cover crops as well as 3 greenhouses worth of plants for the home gardener. We deliver wholesale to the Burlington and Middlebury areas from June through February.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fre.name: Fresh Tracks Farm Vineyard & Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fre.description: Fresh Tracks Farm produces award-winning wines from our 14 acres of vineyards. We also produce Maple Syrup and jam on the farm. Established in 2003, our Berlin, VT vineyard has grown to 14 acres. With the opening of our winery in 2006, we are delighted to be bringing fine, local wines to Central Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/swi.name: Switchback Brewing Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/swi.hours: Monday: 12:00pm - 5:30pm Tuesday: 12:00pm - 4:00pm Wednesday [bottling day]: 10:00am - 4:00pm Thursday: 12:00pm - 5:30pm Friday: 12:00pm - 5:30pm Saturday: 12:00pm - 5:30pm with Tours at 1pm & 2pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/swi.description: Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend. The vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible.The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 10 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials possible; Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale.Visit our new tasting room located at the brewery to try a sample of our latests offerings and purchase merchandise.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/due.name: Due North Vineyard & Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/due.description: We currently have six wines in stock. Made completely from our own grapes.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sou.name: Southwind Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sou.description: Southwind Farm is a sixth generation dairy farm located in the heart of the ‘Mettowee Valley’. Surrounded by rolling hills, the meandering Mettowee River Valley provides a perfect location for our cows to graze the lush vegetation of this beautiful ‘terroir’.  Jeremy Russo crafts an artisanal cheese using the milk from his herd of Holstein cows. A cheese that is similar in style to an alpine raclette.  It is aged for 60 days and can be found at our farm store or various other local retailers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/par.name: Parker Pie Co.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/par.hours: Closed Monday. Open Tuesday - Sunday: 11am-9pm Friday & Saturday until 10pm.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/par.description: The Parker Pie Company started as a small pizza shop in the back of the Lake Parker Country Store. While it is still a little pizza shop in the back of a country store, the quality of the food and the community atmosphere has turned it into a favorite eatery and pub for locals and seasonal clientele alike.  The Parker Pie Co. is a foodie destination not to be missed. In addition to our famous pizza, our revolving beer menu features both Vermont brews and the best fermented beverages from around the globe.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fid.name: Fiddlehead Brewing Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fid.description: Fiddlehead Brewing Company is one of Vermont’s newest craft breweries located in the beautiful town of Shelburne, Vermont.  Our mission is to produce full flavored beers with the true beer connoisseur in mind.  We focus on depth of flavor, freshness of ingredients, and incorporating local products when possible.  Renowned brew master and owner Matthew Cohen (known industry wide as Matty O)  is on a continual quest to craft the perfect pint.  While several seasonal selections are always available on tap at the brewery, our flagship beer, the Fiddlehead IPA,  can be found on draft lines all over Northern Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.name: Chelsea Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/che.description: Located on the North Common in downtown Chelsea, VT - at the intersections of Rte 110 and 113.  The Chelsea Farmers Market aims to provide: 1. an economically strong outlet for vendor products, 2. a source for high quality, healthy, local, sustainably produced goods for customers and 3. a vibrant gathering place for Chelsea and surrounding communities

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/com.name: Common Man Restaunrant, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/com.hours: Tuesday	 - Saturday 6:00–9:00 pm, Sunday - Monday closed
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/com.description: The Common Man Restaurant is located in the heart of mad river valley, between Lincoln Peak and Mount Ellen. Sited in a 19th century barn the dining room is elegant in its simplicity. With hand hewn beams framing an open hearth fireplace the 100 seat restaurant is inviting and intimate. Since the Orsini family opened their doors in the 1960s, 3209 German Flats Road has been a place for locals and visitors alike to gather for a quality Vermont experience. Now in its fourth generation of operation new owners Adam Longworth and Lorien Waters are working hard to re-energize this Vermont dining institution with small town hospitality and world class cuisine, Our mission at The Common Man is to provide out guests with unparalleled Vermont dining by maintaining a dedication to quality product, inspired cuisine, staff development and guest experience. Please join us for an uncommonly good meal that is complimented by the warm hospitality of our staff.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dor.name: Dorset Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dor.description: The Dorset Farmers Market is a producer only market located in beautiful Dorset Vermont.  We are committed to the following principles: grow, create, buy and sell locally. We encourage direct communication between local farmers and consumers. We provide a family friendly marketplace for customers to purchase locally grown, and locally produced products. We are open 42 weeks of the year. Our market reflects the diversity of our region and its local growers, producers, bakers and artists provide a variety of products, including green produce, meats, cheeses, breads, specialty food items, wine, jewelry, pottery and more.  EBT and Debit accepted!Winter market held weekly at the J.K. Adams Kitchen Store and Factory on Rte 30 in Dorset on Saturdays from 10:00am-2:00pm from the third Saturday in October to the third Saturday in May.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.name: Halladay's Harvest Barn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.hours: Mon - Fri: 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM, Sat: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM, Sun: CLOSED
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.description: Halladays sits on a hill, in Vermont, overlooking the beautiful Connecticut River Valley. Open since 1895 on a terrace of beautiful Victorian homes, Halladays has evolved into a thriving specialty herb producer, greenhouse & gift shop. Halladays florist's talented designers can create & deliver perfect flowers for all the important occasions in your life. Halladays specializes in elegant country weddings for 10 or 500 guests. Halladays Harvest Barn produces on site the famous line of Harvest Barn specialty foods & dried arrangements. Products include unusual blends such as garlic chipolte, chardonnay and tomato basil herb mixes, no bake cheesecakes including tiramisu and key lime, and delicious infused garlic oils & vinegars. We welcome you to visit our beautiful new store in downtown Bellows Falls. The new shop is filled to the brim with flowers, all 70 harvest barn products, locally made gifts, jewlery, cards and a well stocked plant room. Our flowers arrive daily from around the world and are easily accessible in our customer friendly walk-in cooler. Pick up some local gifts, flowers or just come and browse and enjoy all the new shop has to offer.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.name: Harvest Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.description: Harvest Market is a one-stop gourmet shop offering delicious salads, sandwiches, entrees, baked goods, and breads prepared by our chefs and bakers! We also offer an incredible selection of wonderful cheeses, meats, wine, beer, farm-fresh produce, and specialty food items.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/win.name: Windfall Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/win.description: We grow apples, pears, plums, cherries, and quince in the orchard. The market garden has a variety of vegetables throughout the season, and foraged foods during the growing season. We also produce and sell Ice Cider at farmer’s markets and at our farm stand. Come visit to sample our products and learn more about the orchard!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ada.name: Adams Apple Orchard & Farm Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ada.hours: Open Seasonally From Mid-April to December 24th. Farm Market: Open Daily 9-6 Apple Orchard: Open Daily 10-5 Please call ahead before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ada.description: For over 25 years the Adams Apple Orchard & Farm Market  has provided the highest quality produce and Vermont Products possible.  We have grown from a small family orchard into a richly diverse farm, offering fresh produce, specialty products, baked goods, annuals, perennials, crafts, toys and more!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dow.name: Downtown Grocery, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dow.description: Casual fine dining restaurant focusing on local foods and house made products.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/old.name: Old Tavern Restaurant at the Grafton Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/old.hours: Dinner is served nightly from 6-9 p.m. Breakfast is served daily from 8-10 a.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/old.description: Chef Smith endorses and promotes the incorporation of seasonal, locally grown food and artisanal products for their exceptional flavors and unsurpassed quality. The inn's large organic kitchen garden features heirloom vegetables and herbs used in the restaurant.The inn's popular Tuesday night Localvore dinner series features a 100% local three-course menu.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/14t.name: 14th Star Brewing Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/14t.description: Today, in Franklin County, Vermont, Army veteran Steve Gagner is honoring his home state and passion – brewing great beer – with 14th Star Brewing Co.14th Star is Steve’s 1,200-square-foot nanobrewery on Lower Newton Street, in St. Albans City.We currently produce about 28 barrels of beer a month (about 900 gallons) in small batches from original recipes.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/el-.name: El Cortijo Taqueria Y Cantina
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/el-.hours: Mon -Thu:11:30 am-12:00 am  Fri - Sat:11:30 am-1:00 am  Sun:11:30 am-12:00 am
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/el-.description: Mexican Taqueria and Cantina serving local tacos, snacks, appetizers, and weekend brunch additions. The bar offers an extensive Tequila list, margaritas of the highest quality using fresh squeezed juices and 100% Agave tequilas, draft beers from VT, Mexico and beyond and house-made sangria.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.name: Hilltopper Cafe at St. Johnsbury Academy
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.hours: During the school year, business hours are: Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday 11:15-1:00.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hil.description: The Hilltopper Restaurant is open to the public and is serviced by Academy students to provide real-world restaurant experience.  The restaurant is a "working classroom."  Students are instructed in meal preparation, hosting and wait-staff, procurement, food safety, and the financial management of a business establishment.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lud.name: Ludlow Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lud.description: The Ludlow Farmers' Market provides locally grown and raised produce, artisanal food products and well made crafts made by the community, for the community.  EBT and Debit Accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.name: Boyer's Orchard and Cider Mill
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.hours: Open September to December, 7 days a week, 9:30-5:30
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/boy.description: Pick your own apple orchard. Fresh pressed cider. Local grown fruits and vegetables. Cider donuts, baked goods, honey, maple syrup, pumpkins.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sol.name: SoLo Farm and Table
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sol.hours: Open Monday, Thursday, Sunday 5:30-9 and Friday and Saturday 5:30-10
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sol.description: SoLo Farm and table is a husband and wife owned and operated restaurant, serving modern American food in a comfortable country atmosphere. We source as much food as possible from local farms and purveyors and our menu reflects the various seasons and the best Vermont has to offer.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lib.name: Liberty Hill Farm Bed & Breakfast
categories: Farm Visits, Farm Stays, Inns & B&B's
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lib.description: Stay at a working dairy farm with 150 head of cattle and generous amounts of kittens! This farm vacation offers lodging with meals (dinner and breakfast) served at the family table. Visit the barn, swim or fish in the river, hike or snowshoe in the woods. Great place to schedule a family reunion or find new friends! Featured in Family Fun, Yankee Magazine, Gourmet, Travel and Leisure.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/alm.name: Almost Home Market and Fine Catering
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/alm.description: Almost Home Market is located in downtown Bristol, VT.  We offer a wonderful, community atmosphere with freshly made baked goods, sandwiches, soups, salads and convenience gourmet foods. Browse our selection of hand picked wines, Vermont and specialty beer, and unique housewares and gifts. With over 20 years of wedding planning, our catering services can help create the perfect menu and service style for every event. Stop by and visit us soon!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ott.name: Otter Creek Brewing & Wolaver's Visitor Center and Pub
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ott.description: We are a local brewery who is now serving fresh, local food in our visitor center.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.name: Cabot Annex Store
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.hours: Open 9:00am - 6:00pm, Closed on Thanksgiving, Christmas & New Years Day
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.description: Located along Vermont’s Route 100, the Cabot Annex Store is a favorite stop whenever you're in the greater Stowe/Waterbury area.  Browse our fantastic selection of Cabot products, sample our award-winning cheeses, and delight in many other Vermont specialty foods.  Shop our collection of Vermont-made crafts.  Enjoy our choice selection of Vermont microbrews and domestic, international, and Vermont wines. Stop by the Snow Farm Winery tasting corner, pick up some award-winning Lake Champlain Chocolates, re-energize with a cup of coffee from Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, and more!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tj-.name: TJ Buckley's
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tj-.hours: Open for Dinner Wednesday thru Sunday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tj-.description: TJ Buckley's Uptown Dining has been serving seasonal and local cuisine since 1983.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/o-b.name: O Bread Bakery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/o-b.hours: Open Mon: 7:00 am-4:00pm Tue - Sun: 7:00 am-6:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/o-b.description: Family owned and operated for 30 years. European-style breads, organic ingredients from our hearth oven bakery at Shelburne Farms since 1977- a decade or so ahead of the current surge of interest in "artisan" breads. O Bread supplies world-class breads to discriminating bread-lovers: stores, restaurants, individuals - around Vermont and around the country.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bos.name: Boston Post Dairy, LLC
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bos.description: Robert and Gisele Gervais, along with their fifteen children, have been farming since 1960.  They bought the Boston Post Dairy with their four daughters in 2007, and added a creamery with viewing windows to allow visitors to watch the cheese making process, as well as a small retail store where they sell cheeses, goat milk soaps, maple syrup and bakery items all made at the farm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/how.name: Howrigan Family Farms
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/how.hours: Spring during sugaring season - call ahead
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/how.description: We have been pioneers in the creation of pure Vermont maple syrup here in Fairfield since 1876. The seventh generation would welcome your visit.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/art.name: Artesano
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/art.hours: Our meadery is open seasonally for tours and tastings Thursdays through Sundays (and Holiday Mondays) from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m. or by appointment.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/art.description: Located in the Northeast Kingdom of Vermont, Artesano produces high quality, hand crafted meads from local honey and fruit. Small batch sizes and attention to detail transform one of nature’s sweetest gifts to a fine wine that can be enjoyed throughout the year. Production began in the Summer of 2009 and our Tradtional Mead is now available.As a sweet side note, Artesano also produces handmade ice cream featuring sauces and toppings made locally.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/con.name: Consider Bardwell Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/con.hours: Self-serve farm store is open year round. The farm is open to visitors on weekends. Please call ahead.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/con.description: Consider Bardwell Farm in West Pawlet Vermont is a producer of award winning handmade cheese from goat and cow milk.  Our animals rotationally graze on organic pastures to produce the sweetest milk and tastiest cheese.  Our raw milk cheese is antibiotic and hormone free, and nutritionally complete.  Farm tours, cheese-making workshops, and farm dinners scheduled throughout the year.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lin.name: Lincoln Peak Vineyard and Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lin.hours: Open Daily 11-5 for tastings, picnics, and walks.  Please call ahead if you're interested in a winery tour.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lin.description: Lincoln Peak Vineyard offers a selection of red, white and rose wines in a friendly informal tasting room. A large, covered deck overlooks our pond and vineyard. With 12 acres of vineyard, we are Vermont's largest grape producer. We use only our own grapes in our wines. Our Marquette won Best in Show Red Wine, and our La Crescent won a Double Gold Medal at the International Cold Climate Wine Competition.You're welcome to walk through the vineyard, tour the winery, bring a picnic, learn about our story and, of course, taste the wines.Our wines are 100 % Estate Bottled, which means that we use only grapes that are grown on our farm.We're located three miles north of Middlebury, just off Rt 7 on River Rd. Look for our signs -- and grapevines -- on Rt 7.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/twi.name: Twin Maple Sugarworks
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/twi.description: Twin Maple Sugarworks is a family owned sugaring operation.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pou.name: Poultney Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pou.description: Wander down Poultney’s Main Street to find fresh vegetables and fruits, handcrafted breads, honey, local meats, eggs, maple syrup, crafts, and more at the Poultney Farmers’ Market.With an almost European flair, the Poultney market has been a gathering place for locals. The market has been a staple in Poultney for over thirty-five years.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kil.name: Killdeer Farm & Farm Stand
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kil.hours: Farm Stand open daily May-Early December Mon-Fri: 10am-6pm Sat: 9am-6pm Sun: 10am-5pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kil.description: Killdeer is a Certified Organic vegetable and strawberry farm in Norwich, VT where we've grown and lived for over 30 years. We pride ourselves in growing and selling diverse produce varieties selected foremost for their flavor. We pay careful attention to the highest quality standards we can possibly maintain. While we sell 90% of what we grow at our farm stand (open 7 days a week from May through Thanksgiving), we also wholesale to local food coops; work with restaurants and caterers; and partner with local businesses.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.name: Maple View Farm Alpacas
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.hours: By appointment - please call to set up visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/map.description: Located on 100 scenic acres in western Vermont just north of Brandon, Maple View Farm Alpacas breeds and sells high quality alpacas.We invite you to visit and learn about these gentle, intelligent creatures, then browse the farm store which features products made from luxurious alpaca fiber. Let us introduce you to the wonderful lifestyle and business opportunities provided as an alpaca breeder.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/eno.name: Enosburg Falls Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/eno.hours: Saturdays and Tuesdays: May 18 - Oct 26: Saturdays 9:00am-1:00pm and May 21 - October 29: Tuesdays 3:00pm-6:30pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/eno.description: A more-than-20-year-old bazaar offers herbs, jellies, vegetables and just-baked goodies in the heart of the village.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.name: Williston Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.description: We are excited to announce our market day and time: Wednesdays from 4pm to 7pm starting June through October.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.name: Lunchbox Market - Newport
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.description: The Lunchbox is a mobile farmers’ market and commercial kitchen that brings locally grown food and food-based education to communities in northern Vermont. The market’s mission is to improve fresh food access, provide a reliable outlet for new and small scale growers and value-added producers, and to create a gathering place for community activities and meals. We’ll accomplish this by: Visiting sites including senior meal sites and low-income housing sites once per week with fresh produce, dairy, meat, and flour from local farms. We’re looking to expand to prepared food in the Spring. Leading workshops on cooking, food preservation, and other food topics. Creating a vibrant community hub with shared meals, skills, and the arts.Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fou.name: Four Pillars Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fou.hours: Patrons are always welcome to stop by and visit the farm during daylight hours throughout the summer growing season. Our garden begins producing in late June, where PYO beans and sugar snap peas are available for several weeks.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fou.description: Four Pillars Farm is a small, diversified produce farm located in southern Addison county, VT. Owned and operated by Peter Cousineau for nearly three years, the farm's five acres boast some of the richest soil in the state, producing vegetables unsurpassed in quality, taste and appearance.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mit.name: Mitch's Maple Sugarhouse
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mit.description: Third generation maple operation.  View maple syrup production during March and April. Retail sales open year round. Good parking, Easy accessibility.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: North Hero House Inn & Restaurant, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: The North Hero House Inn and Restaurant is a historic bed and breakfast located in the Lake Champlain Islands with a spectacular view of the Green Mountains.  The 26 room Inn is open year around and is ideal for vacations, weddings and conferences.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mou.name: Mountain Top Inn and Resort
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mou.hours: Breakfast: 7:30 - 9:30 am  Lunch: hours vary   Dinner: 5:30 - Close
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mou.description: The Mountain Top Inn & Resort offers unparalleled dining in the rustically elegant restaurant framed by spectacular mountain peaks and complemented by a Wine Spectator Award-Winning Wine List.  The Highlands Tavern features casual bistro fare with seasonal outdoor dining on the Terrace.  We welcome local guests, as well as our Resort guests to both restaurants and we are children friendly.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jer.name: Jersey Girls Farm Cafe and Market at WAAWWE
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jer.description: A local foods market that really and truly is 100% LOCAL foods from LOCAL farmers! Great food for meeting your every day needs as well as those special items for fancy meals, hostess gifts, and the yummiest souvenirs you can buy.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nes.name: Neshobe River Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nes.hours: Please call before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nes.description: Neshobe River Winery is located in a late 1700's post and beam barn has been restored into a fully operating winery and operating next to The Old Mill Inn, a four room bed and breakfast. The property overlooks the fifth hole of the Neshobe Golf Course and the Neshobe River crosses the property.  The winemaker, Patrick Foley has been making wine for over ten years and along with his family, is excited to share the experience, tastes and views to all visitors and guests. Take a tour through our vineyard as the sun sets over the rolling hills of the beautiful Green Mountain State of Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/swe.name: Sweet Retreat Guesthouse and Sugarworks
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/swe.description: Take in the splendor of Vermont's mountains as you relax in the quiet comfort and privacy of our well-appointed guesthouse. Sweet Retreat is nestled in the heart of the Green Mountains, conveniently located fifteen minutes south of the capital city of Montpelier, forty minutes to Sugarbush, Stowe, and Bolton Valley ski resorts, and an hour from Burlington International Airport. You will find our spacious guesthouse equipped with everything you need to stay a night, a week, or even a month! To get you started, we stock the guesthouse with ample breakfast fixings for your first morning meal. We invite you to help yourself to fresh veggies from our lush garden in summer, and to complementary maple syrup from our sugarhouse year round throughout your stay. Food shopping is six miles away, and fine dining within a ten minute drive.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sun.name: Sunrise Orchards, Inc.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sun.description: Sunrise Orchards is a 200 acre, family owned and operated, wholesale apple farm devoted to growing excellent apples for our local community as well as the entire Northeast region.  We grow approximately 130,000 bushels of apples each year including varieties such as McIntosh, Empire, Cortland, Honeycrisp, Macoun, Red Delicious, Jonagold, Granny Smith and Paula Red.  When harvest begins at Sunrise Orchards in mid-August, we pack and distribute our apples through our local delivery route all over Vermont and outside the state to markets in Boston, New York, Philadelphia and Washington, D.C. through the following May or June.  Explore our site to learn more about our growing methods, our wonderful staff and where you can find Sunrise Orchards apples!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ski.name: Skinny Pancake - Burlington, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ski.description: In 2006 The Skinny Pancake became the first vending cart ever to join the Vermont Fresh Network.  Since joining the membership The Skinny Pancake has grown significantly.  In June 2007, The Skinny Pancake opened a waterfront restaurant in the LEED Certified Lake & College building at the Main Street Landing complex on Lake Champlain.  The Skinny Pancake continues to believe in the importance and potential of the double bottom line:  financial viability and socially responsible business practices.  We source as much of our food from the local economy as possible.  Aside from sugar, salt, and vanilla extract, our basic crepe is a 100% local product.  In addition to being Burlington's only creperie, The Skinny Pancake has recently become Burlington's only Fondue Parlor.  The Church Street vending cart location continues to operate on nice days for lunch and dinner while The Pancake Tour Bus still makes stops at festivals and fairs throughout the Northeast during the summer & fall months. OPENING JUNE 5, 2009 IN MONTPELIER!!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ski.name: Skinny Pancake - Montpelier, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ski.description: The Skinny Pancake is a unique creperie/coffee house in two locations: Burlington & Montpelier VT. We started our food company with a cart on Church Street in Burlington in the summer of 2003. Over the past several years, we have expanded the business to include a fair & festival tour business, a catering operation and finally a restaurant--first in Burlington & the Mini Skinny in Montpelier.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wes.name: West River Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wes.description: The West River Farmers Market is nestled on the banks of the West River at the crossroads of Rtes 100 and 11 in Londonderry, VT. In the center of Southern Vermont we bring together the finest products that our state has to offer. Come stroll through our market, while munching on a freshly baked pastry; taste the sharp freshness of cheeses that are world renowned; savor the sun ripened fruit; and of course, don't leave without a sack full of fresh produce to create dishes that memories are made from.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pro.name: Prohibition Pig
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pro.hours: Mon - Thu:4:00 pm-12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am-1:00 am Sun: 11:30 am-12:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pro.description: Waterbury's premier restaurant, featuring New England's largest and best curated selection of Craft Beer, as well as the finest barbecue north of the Carolinas.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.name: Middlebury YourFarmstand
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mid.hours: Pick-up: Thursdays 3:30-6pm Mahaney Center for the Arts or Chamber of Commerce (93 Court Street, Middlebury)

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ott.name: Otter Valley Winery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ott.description: Otter Valley Winery offers high quality Vermont grape wines. Owned and operated by Stephen and Ursula Zahn, our almost 5 acre (and still growing) vineyard features variety of grapes: reds - Marquette, Frontenac, Frontenac Gris and St Croix and whites - LaCrescent and Frontenac Blanc. Farming grapes is both science and art, with gray areas of interpretation in each and our goal is to shepherd the fruit to its greatest expression using the tools of both. Combining meticulous winemaking practices and talent with a genuine love of the land and support for the Vermont wine community, Otter Valley Winery is capitalizing on the region’s potential to create world-class wines. Our goal is to make high quality wines that reflect the climate, soil and beauty of the state of Vermont.  Located on 15 wooded acres Cozy Cottages welcomes guests with clean, cozy clapboard style Vermont cottages. Our cozy cottages are located right in the backyard of Otter Valley Winery.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wai.name: Waitsfield Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wai.description: The Waitsfield Farmers' Market can be found on the Mad River Green in Waitsfield, Vermont on Saturdays from 9am to 1pm.  It runs from the middle of May to the middle of October.  You can find fresh produce, flowers, seedlings, honey, wool, eggs, meat, cheese and other farm products. In addition you can find crafts made in Vermont, baked goods, and prepared food. Every Saturday we have live entertainment provided by local musicians. You will also find community groups such as the Vermont Festival of the Arts, Localvores, local libraries and fire departments providing information and doing fundraising.  We now have t-shirts and canvas tote bags bearing our logo! We also have Mad River Valley Greens - our new market money. They make great wedding favors! See the manager at the market for purchase.Visitors are welcome to bring their well-behaved pets on leash.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tra.name: Trapp Family Lodge
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tra.description: European-style cuisine featured in our three restaurants -- The Dining Room, The Lounge, and The Austrian Tea Room -- each with its own distinct character. Seasonal menus to reflect both Austrian and Vermont traditions. Weekly wine tastings, jazz pianist & harpist performing nightly. Reservations requested. More than a decade ago Johannes von Trapp started thinking about brewing his own beer, for guests of the resort. His dream was to produce an American version of the tasty Lager he has enjoyed over the years on his trips to the countryside near his ancestral Austrian home.Johannes’ dream became reality in the Spring of 2010, with the opening of the Trapp Family Brewery. The modest facility (60,000 or so gallons a year) is located in the lower level of the DeliBakery (formerly the Austrian Tea Room), where draughts of the heavenly concoction will be available year round.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ess.name: Essex Resort and Spa, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ess.hours: Amuse open Sunday through Thursday - 5:30 to 10 p.m. Friday & Saturday - 5:30 to 11 p.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ess.description: The Essex is a true Vermont food destination for guests from near and far!  We offer a unique mix of culinary offerings!  Dine with us in Amuse, our signature restaurant that showcases the best of what Vermont farms and our own organic gardens produce.  For a culinary adventure, have a seat at Chef's Table at Amuse. View, talk and taste as our chef prepares your food in front of you.  Acquaint yourself with and savor local ingredients as different courses are created each and every night.
