Delicious and engaging! To try your hand in using some of Vermont’s finest ingredients, why not take a cooking class!  Offered daily with a variety of classes to fit every cook’s interest, you will cook with a chef to teach and encourage you in this hands-on low pressure learning environment!  If a relaxed casual evening is what you crave join us in The Tavern for some locally sourced pub favorites!   The Essex is a true destination, offering a full-service Spa and Fitness Center, along with our culinary offerings-- all of which perfectly complement our classic accommodations. The Essex is the premier choice for your next group event and is the perfect Vermont wedding destination for dozens of happy couples tying the knot each year.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cou.name: Couture's Maple Shop & Bed and Breakfast
categories: Maple Syrup, Inns & B&B's, Farm Visits, Farm Stays
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cou.description: We operate a dairy and maple farm.  Our Bed & Breakfast offers our guests an opportunity to see farm life the way we live it!  Our farm is certified organic. Our milk is sold to Organic Valley and Agri-Mark and contributes to making Cabot dairy products and Stonyfield yogurt.  We make a wide variety of maple products which are available for sale at our farm store and on our website.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/soy.name: SoYo Frozen Yogurt
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/soy.hours: Summer Hours: Sun. - Thu.: 11:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Fri. - Sat.: 10:00 AM - 11:00 PM
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/soy.description: At SoYo, our goal is to make the most delicious frozen yogurt you've ever tasted. Achieving that goal begins with choosing the right ingredients. That's why we buy only the highest-quality dairy products. You won't find any synthetic growth hormones in the milk or yogurt we purchase. Whenever possible, we source our fruit and toppings in the state of Vermont, and we always try to offer in-season options. As a result, our offerings are constantly changing. When you stop by our shop, you will always find something new.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pet.name: Pete's Greens
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/pet.description: Pete's Greens grows certified organic specialty produce and delivers to stores and restaurants throughout Vermont.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.name: Charlotte, Shelburne, & Pine Street On-line Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.hours: Thursdays 3-7pm, year-round; contact markets for locations

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/arl.name: Arlington's West Mountain Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/arl.hours: Restaurant Hours: Breakfast 8am- 9:30am Monday through Friday  Weekends from 8am-10am Dinner: Served Nightly 6pm-8:30pm with Vermont Artisan Cheeses and Fresh Fruit at 6pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/arl.description: Nestled on 150 mountainside acres overlooking the Battenkill Valley, the century old West Mountain Inn has been welcoming travelers with warmth and hospitality for the last 30 years. The Inn offers romantic, antique-filled guest rooms, fantastic views, extensive gardens and fabulous dining... all providing the perfect get-away to relax and re-connect. Dining here at the Inn is a very important part of your stay. Chef Jeff Scott prepares delicious New England Fare with the freshest, local and organic ingredients.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fir.name: Fire & Ice Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fir.hours: Open every night for drinks, dinner, and sandwiches. The Pub opens at 4:30 pm, and the dining room opens at 5:00 pm. Friday and Saturday opening at Noon, Sundays at 1:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fir.description: A family owned and operated local landmark for over 30 years, Fire & Ice is famous for Prime Rib, homemade mashed potatoes, steaks, seafood and our 55 item salad bar, including shrimp, sushi. and carrot cake. A fun and nostalgic atmosphere, and a children's movie theatre, too! Great burgers, sandwiches and Happy Hour 4:30-6:30 daily in the Big Moose Pub.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.name: Lunchbox Mobile Market - Irasburg
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lun.description: The Lunchbox is a mobile farmers’ market and commercial kitchen that brings locally grown food and food-based education to communities in northern Vermont. The market’s mission is to improve fresh food access, provide a reliable outlet for new and small scale growers and value-added producers, and to create a gathering place for community activities and meals. We’ll accomplish this by: Visiting sites including senior meal sites and low-income housing sites once per week with fresh produce, dairy, meat, and flour from local farms. We’re looking to expand to prepared food in the Spring.  Leading workshops on cooking, food preservation, and other food topics. Creating a vibrant community hub with shared meals, skills, and the arts.Accepts EBT and Debit Cards

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wal.name: Walden Mountain Angus & Alpacas
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wal.description: We are a medium-sized (Approx. 50 Alpacas) located in the picturesque East Hardwick Vermont. Our farm is situated on Coles Pond Rd. overlooking the beautiful hills and valleys of Northern Vermont. Our breeding goals for our alpacas is for fine fiber, excellent temperment, and healthy bloodlines. We are currenlty selling breeding alpacas, "pet" alpacas, and a multitude of products made from their fiber. Some of our hand-made products are hats, scarves, mittens, and baby knits. We also sell other alpaca products including socks, scarves, and hats that are made by the NE Alpaca Fiber Co-op (NEAFC). If you are interested in purchasing any alpacas or products (hats, scarves, mittens or yarn), please call or email us.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hen.name: Hen of the Wood
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hen.hours: Serving Dinner Tuesday through Saturday starting at 5
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hen.description: At Hen of the Wood, the food is simple, uncomplicated and down-to-earth. We create daily changing menus based on the wealth of premium ingredients found only miles from the restaurant in the lush Green Mountains and Champlain Valley.Our goal is to provide a true Vermont dining experience and showcase the regions most vibrant foods.We look forward to cooking for you!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/are.name: Arethusa Farm, Inc
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/are.hours: We love to have people visit our farm. We are open to hosting groups of all sizes and all ages. Please call ahead before planning a visit.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/are.description: We're a 20-acre certified organic vegetable farm located only two miles north of downtown Burlington. We grow over 50 varieties of vegetables and herbs and we sell the freshest vegetables directly to our local restaurants and grocery stores. We want people to be connected to their food, to eat seasonally, and to get to know their farmers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/la-.name: La Villa Bistro
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/la-.hours: We are open Monday - Thursday 11:00 - 9:00, Friday and Saturday 11:00 - 10:00 and Sunday from 4:00 - 9:00
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/la-.description: A sixty seat bistro-cafe with soft lights and jazz music to soothe the senses. Casual dining that is perfect for family or your first date...La Villa offers gourmet Pizza, Pasta, Panini, and Grill entrees.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/aga.name: Agape Hill Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/aga.description: Have a day to remember at Agape Hill Farm where you can feed the animals, walk a llama or create fiber art!  Offering farm tours, llama trail walks, workshops and a personalized visit program.  The Fiber Shop is open year round and features raw and processed fiber from our animals, dyed fiber collections, fiber art and other farm-related gifts.  Farm Tours and Trail Walks are scheduled by appointment from May through October.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hun.name: Huntington River Vineyard at Galloping Hill Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hun.hours: The vineyard is open to visitors by appointment beginning in June.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hun.description: Situated on the rolling hillsides of Huntington, Galloping Hill Vineyards has 7 varieties of red & white grapes. The vineyard operation is run by the Guilfoy family, managed by father & son, Ed & Ryan Guilfoy.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green Mountain Girls Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.hours: Farm Stand Open Thursday evenings from 4pm to 7pm. Contact us at 802-505-9840 or reservations@eatstayfarm.com to make a reservation.
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Farm Visits, Farm Stays
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: We are a small diversified farm providing an Omnivore's Farm Share. We raise healthy (natural & sustainable), happy (free-range & loved) animals & vegetables for sale to residents and restaurants.We practice relational farming, inviting members and visitors to share and enjoy our farm and its products—connecting people to farms so they can both source high quality, healthy, well-raised food, and so they can learn how their food can be produced sustainably.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cog.name: Coger Farms & Greenhouse
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cog.hours: Mon: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm Wed - Sat: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm Sun: 10:00 am - 3:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cog.description: Kitchen Garden Shop and Greenhouses. Growers of vegetable and herb starts, seeds and seed starting supplies. Full line of organic growing supplies.Quality 4 season growers of specialty produce - carrots, spinach, asian greens, salad mixes, and herbs.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.name: Inn at Weathersfield, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.hours: Restaurant Open Wednesday - Sunday from 5:30 to 9:00
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.description: A full service Inn serving contemporary 'New Vermont' cuisine with an emphasis on local products in a classic 1792 stagecoach stop. We use the finest and freshest ingredients that are found throughout the state. The dinner menu changes weekly based on market and availability.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.name: Vermont Pub & Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.description: Vermont’s original brewpub handcrafts an award-winning variety of real ales and lagers in our cellar brewery.  Our elegant pub and casual service provide a relaxed ambiance to enjoy seafood, steak, burgers and British Empire fare.  The best of Burlington’s vibrant music on stage summer weekend nights.  Outside seating weather permitting.  Experimental beer offered every Monday.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ri-.name: Ri Ra the Irish Pub
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ri-.hours: Mon - Wed: 11:30 am - 12:00 am Thu: 11:30 am - 1:00 am Fri: 11:30 am - 2:00 am Sat: 10:00 am - 2:00 am Sun: 9:00 am - 12:00 am
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ri-.description: In towns and villages across Ireland, the ‘Pub’ is at the heart of the community. Birthday celebrations, sports club meetings, wedding parties, charity events, dancing, laughing, crying; you name it. Expect much the same at Rí Rá.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ech.name: Echo Lake Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ech.description: An authentic Vermont country inn with fine dining.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mis.name: Misty Knoll Farms
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mis.hours: We love visitors and we're easy to find so drop on by!
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mis.description: A family owned and operated farm devoted to producing the finest range poultry and poultry products.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tra.name: Trattoria Delia
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tra.description: A family owned trattoria serving rustic Italian food make from local wild and cultivated edibles.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tro.name: Trout River Brewing Company
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tro.hours: Fridays and Saturdays 4:00pm-9:00pm; Beginning July 4th weekend, open Thursday evening
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tro.description: Trout River Brewing was founded in July 1996 by Dan and Laura Gates. We began brewing in early December of that year. We still own and operate this microbrewery in the northeastern region of Vermont--The Northeast Kingdom! Come visit this special and beautiful place and taste all that the Kingdom has to offer.Trout River Brewing prides itself on creating and serving fresh, all natural, premium ales and lagers. Our beers are made with pure Vermont water, the best imported and domestic malts and hops, and quality yeasts. Nothing else is added and we take nothing away!At Trout River Brewing, we believe that the naturally occuring settling of unfiltered brews results in a more flavorful and complex taste. As well, filtration robs the aroma which is a very important part of the beer experience. Therefore, we do not filter our beers!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nik.name: nika
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nik.hours: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm Sunday - Thursday; 11:00 am - 10:00 pm Friday - Saturday
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nik.description: This "wood-fired gathering place and wine bar" honors Mediterranean cuisine with roasted meats, creative salads, wood-oven pizza and fresh pasta.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.name: Inn at Shelburne Farms
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.hours: Breakfast: 7:30-11:30 am daily, Dinner: 5:30-9:30 pm daily, Sunday Brunch: 8:00 am-1:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.description: The Inn at Shelburne Farms restaurant features regional American cuisine and utilizes fresh, local ingredients served in an elegant 19th century dining room with spectacular lake and mountain views.The Inn at Shelburne Farms was originally the 19th-century country home of Dr. William Seward and Lila Vanderbilt Webb. Restored in 1987, the inn today retains its historic character and continues the tradition of warmth, informal elegance and hospitality enjoyed by guests for more than a century. There are 24 bedrooms & two cottages individually decorated with many original furnishings.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.name: Willow Moon Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.description: Our creamery makes a farmstead and artisinal cheese and as such, is seasonal in nature.  Availability and  flavor depends upon the time of year, the "stage of the milk production" and the natural grasses, herbs and other pasture flora that may be in season.  We strive to produce a consistent, quality product but with the essential elements of "terroir" directing its final outcome. All of our cheese is made by hand from the fresh milk of our own herd of Nigerian Dwarf Dairy Goats and from the Jersey Cows of our neighbors at Hollister Hill Farm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/col.name: Coleman Brook Tavern at Okemo
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/col.hours: Lunch daily from 11:30 a.m. (11 a.m. weekends and holidays) to 3 p.m.  Dinner nightly beginning at 5 pm.  Open until 9 p.m. Sunday-Thursday. Until 10 p.m.  Friday and Saturday.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/col.description: Coleman Brook Tavern is located in The Jackson Gore Inn at Okemo Mountain Resort. CBT redefines the word “comfort” for couples and hungry families. Diners of all ages recognize the restaurant’s elegance, but experience a level of ease with a restaurant that isn’t too stuffy for a dessert that comes complete with graham crackers, slabs of chocolate, marshmallows, skewers and a tabletop campfire for creating gooey S’mores. Coleman Brook Tavern’s Wine Room, for grownups only, offers an ambience that surrounds diners with a display of fine vintages. Coleman Brook Tavern is a Wine Spectator Best of Award of Excellence winner. Coleman Brook Tavern serves lunch and dinner daily during the winter season.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.name: Brass Lantern Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.description: Award winning, romantic, authentic VT B & B Inn in the heart of Stowe VT. Features: packages, fireplaces, views, whirlpools & more. Award winning farm fresh breakfast.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/far.name: Farmhouse Tap & Grill, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/far.description: A farm to table gastropub serving local burgers, charcuterie, cheeses and innovative specials. The tap room offers highly prized beers from Vermont's backyard and beyond. Seasonal outdoor beer garden and downstairs speakeasy for your enjoyment. Cheers!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/win.name: Windham Hill Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/win.description: Windham Hill Inn is a small country inn with a fine dining restaurant and 21 luxurious rooms on 160 unspoiled acres in Southern VT.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/new.name: Newport Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/new.hours: Saturdays: May 11 - October 19; 9am-2pm; Wednesdays: May 29 - October 16; 9:00am-2:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/new.description: If you're looking for a genuine, farm-to-table experience, then the Newport Farmers' Market is a must-see for you.  Open from May to mid-October, Wednesdays and Saturdays 9-2. Rain or Shine.  A gathering of farmers and craftspeople sell items that they have made or grown to the local public.  Produce, vegetables, plants, fruits, jams, pickles, meats, eggs, Vermont maple syrup, baked goods, wood products, hot food, herbs, annuals, perennials, breads, tables, cards, and lots more await.  EBT and Debit accepted!Winter market held monthly from November through April Saturdays 9:30am-1:00pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bas.name: Basin Harbor Club
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bas.hours: Open May through October.  Red Mill (casual) 11:30 am - 10:00 pm.  Main Dining Room 7:00 am - 10:00 am & 6:30 pm - 8:30 pm.  Ranger Room 12:30 pm - 2:30 pm. Call for accomodations and reservations.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bas.description: For over a century, families have been coming to our historic New England resort to escape the hustle and bustle of modern life, recharge, and reconnect with one another while soaking in the timeless beauty of Lake Champlain. With endless activities for guests from golf, tennis, boating, children's programs and 700-acres of walking and hiking, Basin Harbor Club is a Vermont treasure. The dining scene at Basin Harbor leaves every belly happy and full. With three restaurants and weekly outdoor dinners on the North Dock, Basin Harbor is commited to local food sourcing and supporting local farmers and growers. Join them this summer! http://basinharbor.com/dining.php

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dak.name: Dakin Farm - Ferrisburgh
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dak.description: "What Vermont Tastes Like" - Experience the flavor of Vermont's finest pure Vermont Maple Syrup, cob-cmoked meats, thick-sliced bacon, aged cheddar cheese and other specialty foods.  See how they're made and enjoy the FREE samples!  In Spring - don't miss Sugaring Season and try our NEW Crop of Pure Vermont Maple Syrup (Mid March, Annually), In Summer - stop in for a delicious Maple Cremee!; In Fall - enjoy the beautiful colors of fall and sample smoked meats and Artisan cheeses; In Winter - send the very best of Vermont to loved ones - we are your holiday gift headquarters.    Located 9.5 miles south of Shelburne Museum and Vermont Teddy Bear Company and about a half hour South of Burlington.We have a South Burlington location as well!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/st-.name: St. Johnsbury Winter Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/st-.hours: First Saturday of the month from November - April 10:00am - 1:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/st-.description: The Winter Market is held at the Welcome Center, the first Saturday of every month from November through April, 10AM to 1PM.  We also hold Holiday Markets on the third Saturdays of November and December in the St. Johnsbury Welcome Center, 10AM to 1PM.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.name: Champlain Islands Farmers' Market - Grand Isle

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/caf.name: Cafe Provence
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/caf.hours: Tuesday - Saturday Lunch: 11:30am - 2:00pm;  Bistro 2:00pm - 4:30pm; Dinner 5:00pm - 9:00pm Sunday Brunch: 9:00am - 3:00pm; Bistro 3:00pm - 4:30pm Dinner 5:00pm - 9:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/caf.description: French Bistro serving eclectic American/ French foods seven days a week.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green's Sugarhouse
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: A family atmosphere welcomes you at Green's Sugarhouse located in the same "hollow" where the family settled in 1774. Guided tours are available along with samplings of the many maple products we make at the Sugarhouse. See the process from our trees to that jug of syrup you carry home to your family. Easy access, brochure and mailorder for your convenience. Please call before your visit.Visit us during Vermont Maple Open House Weekend with special tours from 10 to 4 each day. Maple sugar-on-snow and maple cotton candy are special open house treats!  March and April is the best season to visit if you want to see maple syrup actually being made. Summer, Fall and Winter are great and you'll still get a full tour.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hea.name: Healthy Living Market and Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hea.hours: Open seven days a week from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hea.description: Healthy Living is Vermont's largest natural foods store, with the state's best selection of local, natural, and organic foods.  Family owned and operated for over 20 years.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/noo.name: Noonie Deli
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/noo.description: We are a locally owned and operating deli, located in the historic Marble Works district in Middlebury.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.name: King Arthur Flour Bakery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.hours: Monday–Friday: 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Saturday: 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Sunday: 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kin.description: Here at the King Arthur Flour Bakery, we use traditional methods and top-quality ingredients to bake our outstanding breads — 7 days a week. Our breads are preservative- and additive-free; a long, slow rise is responsible for their wonderful flavor and keeping qualities. Carefully shaped by hand and baked in a steam-injected brick oven, our wide selection of artisan breads will delight you in every way.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ton.name: Tonewood Maple Reserve Co.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ton.description: Tonewood is redefining a standard for elegance and quality in maple products.  Through collaboration with expert sugarmakers, we produce pure maple syrups and other specialities.  Our products are single-sourced, unblended, and free of additives.  We combine this standard for excellence with sleek design and forward-thinking sustainability practices to produce gourmet products.  By funding climate change research, local farming efforts, and sustainable forest stewardship through our 1% for the Planet membership, we seek to preserve maple production.  We're committed to celebrating maple's naturally sumptuous flavor and under-realized versatility.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/san.name: Sandiwood Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/san.hours: Open twice monthly from May-Oct for on farm to fork dinners. Open April for sugaring tours.  May-June for plant and seedling sales.  June - Oct. fresh produce by appointment.  Check web site or call.
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Maple Syrup, Farm Visits, Classes & Workshops
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/san.description: 75 acre beautiful mountain top farm. 3 acres of diverse produce, herbs, cut flowers, plant sales in spring, 6 greenhouses, maple syrup sales year round including shipping nationwide. On Farm sunset dinners, tours, workshops, Justice of the peace services, catering. Family built and run farm for over 20 years. Eldest daughter is a NECI chef, chemical free practices.We sell our produce at the Stowe Farmers markets on Sundays, wholsale and sell from our farm stand.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.name: Hall Home Place
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.hours: Hall's Tasting Hall will be open from September 7th - October 13th from 11:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.description: Our Cidery is located in the scenic Hall’s Orchard of Isle La Motte. The property has been in our family since the late 1700’s and different generations of Halls have been cultivating apples and pears since the orchard was started. From 1828 until 2005 when the matriarch of the family, Mina Hall, passed away these generations of Halls have lived in the family farm house. The house is one of the historic stone houses built by the Scottish stone mason, James Ritchie. The stone in the house was quarried on the island and ancient coral reef fossils can be found in them.In an effort to help keep the orchard in the family and operating successfully Steve and Carol Hall Stata began restoring the family farm house and in 2008 started a seasonal café. The Café is in a renovated carriage barn attached to the house.Building on the success of the Café, in 2009 we decided to experiment with making Ice Cider.  We made 3 different varieties, all of which were delicious. The response was immediate and we quickly sold everything we had produced and we began making plans for expansion. In 2010 we tripled production and added a fourth variety. 2011 found us tripling again and adding a fifth variety.With the increase production we quickly outgrew our original facilities. In 2011 we completed the restoration of the fruit house, located on the other side of the main house opposite the Cafe. As with many things on an old farm the fruit house had been used for many activities including the storage and packing of apples and for living quarters for at least one set of grandparents. It now is climate controlled and houses both the press equipment and fermentation/aging equipment. The lab and bottling room along with the tasting room are in the main farm house.The Ice Cider is available at the Cidery, many farmers markets in the area, a number of stores throughout Grand Isle, Franklin and Chittenden counties, many wine tasting events through the state and special tasting events help at the Cidery.We also have a very nice apple table wine and Hard Cider. Both are made from the same sweet cider concentrate used in making our Ice Cider.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lak.name: Lake Champlain Chocolates
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/lak.description: Lake Champlain Chocolates offers sweet indulgences that capture the essence of Vermont, the tradition of making fine chocolate, and the pride that goes into each bite.Visit us in person at our Factory Store  - see chocolates made right before your eyes and take in the aromas and tastes (not to mention free samples) of our chocolate factory. Our free, through-the-window Factory Tours are offered on the hour Monday through Friday starting at 10am at our Factory Store and Café location at 750 Pine Street, Burlington, Vermont.  Please note that our hours are subject to change, so please refer to this page for tour time updates and/or cancellations.  If you have any questions please call us 802-864-1807. For Group Tours of 10 people or more, a reservation is required, and tours will be on the half hour.  All reservations must be made at least three days before you plan to visit our factory.  Please call 802-264-2173 to make a reservation.  Our space can safely accommodate a maximum of 35 people per tour.  Groups with a reservation must arrive 10 minutes early.  If your entire group does not arrive 10 minutes early, we may be unable to accommodate your reservation.  Groups under ten people do not need a reservation.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cap.name: Capitol Grounds Cafe and Roastery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cap.hours: Monday - Friday 6:15 am - 5:30 pm; Saturday 7:00 am - 5:30 pm; Sunday 8:00 am - 5:00 pm.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cap.description: Capitol Grounds Café and Roastery is located in the heart of Washington County, Vermont.The Café on State Street in Montpelier serves breakfast, lunch and dinner and has an exhibition space for the area's talented artists. The Café features our own Capitol Grounds fresh roasted coffee, a wide variety of teas, pastries, sandwiches using bagels or croissants, soups, salads and much more.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.name: Vermont Shepherd
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.description: Vermont Shepherd Cheese is the country's most famous and oldest sheep milk cheese. It is created by the Ielpi Major family, who pasture and milk the sheep, make and age the cheese on their 250 acre farm in Westminster West, Vermont. Vermont Shepherd's quality and flavor are a reflection of the wholesome way the family attempts to farm - only using milk from the sheep that graze the healthy, wild pastures, and then treating the milk with care, not pumping or heating too fast. The family makes Vermont Shepherd Cheese in 10 to 30 wheel batches, 3 days a week during grazing season. Because sheep milk is so high in protein, the fat content of Vermont Shepherd Cheese is similar to a low fat cheddar, and, being made of pasture milk, the cheese is especially high in beneficial fatty acids.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green Mountain Blue Cheese and Boucher Family Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: Boucher Family Farm has been making raw milk cheese under the name Green Mountain Blue Cheese since 1999.  The family continues 400 years of agricultural heritage in the region.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sno.name: Snow Goose Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sno.description: Every morning wake to the smell of freshly cooked Vermont Country breakfast, included in your stay, and served in our garden side breakfast room. After fresh baked blueberry muffins, seasonal fresh fruit and a selection of Harney & Sons teas & Green Mountain coffee, choose from a variety of cooked entrees including Snow Goose Bacon seasoned in house, Pannini French Toast, blueberry buttermilk pancakes or our signature, healthy Snow Goose Benedict. In the afternoons we serve complimentary wine and Vermont Cabot sharp cheddar, either fireside in winter or on the deck overlooking the gardens in summer and fall.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: Norwich Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.hours: May 4 - October 26: Saturdays 9:00am-1:00pm; Monthly November through April with special Thanksgiving and Holiday Markets
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: We’ve missed being outside and now we can stretch our booth space to bring an ever-expanding variety of vendors as well as more space for picnics.  Come join us for fresh air and live music and over 50 vendors in our newly expanded market.  Welcome the new vendors and catch up with the regulars.  EBT and Debit accepted!Winter market held monthly at Tracy Hall, 300 Main St. November through April: 1st and 3rd Saturdays of November and December & 1st Saturdays of February, March, April 10:00am-2:00pm

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fat.name: Fat Toad Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fat.hours: Our self-serve farm store is open from 8 am – 6 pm daily.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fat.description: Fat Toad Farm is a small, family owned goat dairy in Vermont specializing in handcrafted traditional Goat's Milk Caramel sauces (Cajeta).  Fat Toad Family, including Steve Reid and his wife Judith Irving, their daughter Hannah Reid and several invaluable interns, milk 47 does twice a day, and use the fresh milk to make their decadent Goat's Milk Caramel, found in specialty food stores across the country.   Self-guided tour brochures are available at the farm store as well as samples and product to buy.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.name: Brandon Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bra.description: The Brandon Farmers Market is held from late May to mid October in Central Park from 9am to 2pm on Fridays. You will find homegrown fresh veggies, homebaked goods, pure Vermont Maple syrup, honey, handcrafted items including jewelry, crocheted items, handspun yarn, handknit items and more.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.name: Inn at the Round Barn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/inn.description: 245 acres of pristine farm land, a restored round barn and a farmhouse turned world class inn/bed and breakfast right in the heart of Vermont in the Mad River Valley's Waitsfield. The Round Barn has been Catering romantic adventurers, the business traveler, weddings and events for over 20 years.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sag.name: Sage Farm Goat Dairy
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sag.description: Sage Farm Goat Dairy is a family-run farm and creamery located on 27 acres of pasture and woodland in Stowe, VT. Established in 2008 by sisters Molly and Katie Pindell with the help of their partners Dave Wilkens and Bob Sabolefski, Sage Farm produces micro-batch artisanal cheeses from the milk of a small herd of registered Alpine dairy goats.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mt-.name: Mt. Tom Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mt-.description: Come visit Woodstock's oldest open air market, operating since 1982.  The market is a real "farmers' market" where vendors literally sell out of the back of their vehicle.  The market provides a unique opportunity to talk to the "people that grew it or made it".  It's a good place to meet your friends and neighbors while supporting local businesses.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/chu.name: Churchill House Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/chu.description: A Green Hotel:  classic country inn for all seasons in the Moosalamoo Nat'l Recreation Area of Green Mountain National Forest.  Vermont offers its best hiking, biking, and skiing from our front door. Nine guest rooms, all with private baths, some with whirlpool. Greet the morning with a hearty full served country breakfast (our recipes recently featured by "Gourmet" & "Yankee"); optionally end the day with a four-course dinner featuring New England and international fare made from the freshest local ingredients.  Russian (and English!) spoken.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.name: Woodstock Inn and Resort
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/woo.description: The Woodstock Inn & Resort, a Preferred Hotel, offers modern amenities and services within a quintessential Vermont setting. 142 Spacious rooms, plush bedding and breathtaking grounds create a cozy, welcoming escape any time of year. Couples, families and adventure seekers alike will find plenty to do both indoors and out. For those looking to unwind and unplug, Our NEW Spa features nourishing treatments and organic products that will leave you feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.The Woodstock Inn & Resort serves gourmet cuisine with fresh, seasonal ingredients. Our four-diamond culinary team specializes in regional recipes and using locally grown food to blend traditional style with sophisticated tastes. For the littler ones, we have a mouth-watering children’s menu with family favorites like mashed potatoes and corn on the cob. Savory side dishes, artisan breads, and rich, decadent desserts complement our full menu selection. Great food, good company and amazing staff will turn your meal into a Woodstock Inn & Resort dining experience.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/joh.name: Johnson Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/joh.address: Village Green (across from Johnson Woolen Mills)
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/joh.description: The Johnson Farmers' Market is open Tuesdays from 3:00 to 6:00. Local items available are: veggies, beef, pork, eggs, coffee, bread, baked treats, relishes, pickled goodies, handmade jewelry, kids t-shirts, crystals, plants, herbs, herbal products, crafts, kombucha, hot tomales, mediterranean food, and more! Come see for yourself and buy locally.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.name: Willow Hill Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wil.description: Willow Hill Farm is a small diversified farm run by a husband and wife team established in 1991. Certified organic by VOF for NOFA-VT (Northeast Organic Farming Association) since 1992, the farm is predominantly a cheese making dairy (we milk both cows and sheep) but we also raise a small patch of U-pick blueberries.  Blueberries are certified organic.We handcraft unique farm-developed and internationally award-winning cheeses that age in our underground cave here on the farm. All aged cheeses ripen on hardwood planks harvested right here on the farm. In July-Aug of each year we are open for blueberry picking.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fiv.name: Five Corners Farmers Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fiv.description: The Five Corners Farmers' Market in downtown Essex Junction is a bustling market. The Farmers' Market was created from an Essex Junction Revitalization project that has the purpose of creating vitality, business and community excitement in our historic downtown.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cap.name: Capital City Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cap.hours: Saturdays 9am-1pm - Every Saturday from May 4th through October 26th 2013
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cap.description: Our market provides area residents and visitors with a place to buy the freshest produce, directly from local growers and supporting Vermont’s agricultural economy.  The Capital City Farmers Market was named "best downtown farmers market" by Yankee Magazine this year and it lives up to this award with 53 vendors each week, over half of them farmers.  Additionally, market food vendors are required to use at least three local farm ingredients in their products.Starting later in May, the market will feature special events including seasonal cooking demonstrations, kids’ activities, and live music.  The market welcomes EBT (3Squares VT) cards.  During the summer, we will be offering extra incentives for EBT users.  Shoppers can also use their debit cards at the market for “market cash.”  Starting July 6th, customers using their EBT cards (Electronic Benefits Transfer) at the Capital City Farmers Market will get additional $2.00 Harvest Health coupons for every $2 they spend (up to $10 per market day).

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sug.name: Sugarbush Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sug.hours: 9am to 5pm every day except Thanksgiving and Christmas
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sug.description: Visit a working maple syrup, cheese and beef farm.  Free admission, free samples of maple syrup and 15 cheeses.  Open year round. While maple sugaring is in the spring, the sugarhouse is open year round with displays, video and explanation of how sap is boiled down to maple syrup.  Walk the maple trail to see how trees are tapped both with buckets and maple tubing.  Farm store, shipping available.  Watch how cheese is hand waxed for safe travel.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dev.name: Devil's Den Farm Bed & Breakfast
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dev.description: We bought the family farm! Our grandparents raised their ten children here. Make our farm your home base for visiting family and friends, vacations or business. Two rooms, one suite, private baths, braided rugs, quilts, continental breakfast in our country kitchen. Purchase our Maple Syrup, ask about our secluded Rolfe Place cabin.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dai.name: Daily Planet, The
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dai.hours: Bar opens daily at 4 p.m.  Dinner begins daily at 5 p.m.  Late-Night menu available... Sun-Thurs until 11 p.m. Fri & Sat until midnight
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dai.description: The Daily Planet- a hush eatery, funky bar and chic solarium. We give you the choice: let orb lamps and celestial surroundings illuminate your fresh-tap brew, go for stargazing au natural at outdoor sidewalk tables or from the indoor solarium, retreat into the dining room for a more private evening.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sal.name: Salt Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sal.hours: Tuesday – Sunday, 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Reservations Recommended, BYOB
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sal.description: Salt’s menu changes every three weeks, and playfully matches seasonal, local ingredients with the flavors and techniques of various culinary traditions, or even other eras. With a focus on warm customer service and flavorful food without fuss, the intimate eatery is suitable for special occasions, or casual nights on the town.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tim.name: Timbers Restaurant at Sugarbush
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tim.hours: Breakfast daily 7:30am-10:00 am, Dinner served Thursday - Monday, 5:30-9 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tim.description: Join us at Timbers for an upscale, slopeside dining experience featuring prime steaks, locally grown produce & seafood.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/vai.name: Vaillancourt Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/vai.description: Vaillancourt Orchard is a family run Vermont apple orchard located on Kendall Road in South Franklin, Vermont. In addition to Pick Your Own apples and Pick Your Own blueberries, we have pre-picked apples, apple pies, apple sauce, cider doughnuts, Vermont Maple Syrup, apple cider and, in season, pumpkins. We look forward to having you visit our orchard, however, it is always advisable to call for recorded picking information.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mag.name: Magic Hat Brewery and Artifactory
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mag.hours: WINTER (Columbus Day to Memorial Day) Mon-Thurs	10am - 6pm; Fri- Sat 10am - 7pm; Sunday 12pm - 5pm; Free Guided Tours Thurs - Fri 3pm, 4pm, 5pm; Sat 1pm, 2pm, 3pm, 4pm, 5pm; Sunday 1:30pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mag.description: Where ancient alchemy meets modern-day science to create the best tasting beer on the planet.  Visit the Artifactory for free samples, tours, and the most unusual shopping experience.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ply.name: Plymouth Artisan Cheese
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ply.hours: Open to the public -  please call for hours.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ply.description: We are a Vermont company that produces artisanal raw cow's milk cheeses with milk received from a single local herd that we continually monitor for quality. All of our milk comes from a farm that engages in the best dairy practices and humane treatment of their livestock. Only the finest and freshest milk goes into our cheeses. We are also dedicated to the ideas and philosophies of the slow food movement; knowing where your food comes from, how it's made, and to the preservation of the working landscapes of Vermont. Your patronage will help ensure that future.The Plymouth Cheese Factory in Plymouth, Vermont, is one of the oldest cheese operations in the United States, and was founded by John Coolidge the father of the 30th President of the United States, Calvin Coolidge. The factory is located at the Coolidge State Historic Site, in the preserved village of Plymouth Notch.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sno.name: Snow Farm Vineyard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sno.hours: Vineyard and tasting room in South Hero is open 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. every day from May 1 - December 31. Call during off-season.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sno.description: Welcome to Vermont’s first vineyard and grape winery.  What you’ll see at the vineyard began as a dream and passion in 1992 - the fierce desire to keep land agricultural in Vermont. With land becoming more valuable for its development potential than for its worth farming, we were concerned with the future of our state, afraid of losing  what makes Vermont unique.Fortunately our dream became the dream of others, and together, Vermont’s first commercial grape vineyard and winery came into existence in 1996. It is our hope that we can provide an alternative for farmers, so that they can rededicate their land to a new agricultural pursuit and keep it working rather than selling it for residential or commercial purposes. Supporting us supports our mission of keeping the land open and working.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dol.name: Dolly Gray Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dol.description: Pick-your-own apples, 12 varieties, including antique varieties.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ced.name: Cedar Circle Farm & Education Center
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ced.hours: Farmstand and Hello Café are open May-October. Farm tours by appointment year round.
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Eateries, Farm Visits, Classes & Workshops
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ced.description: Cedar Circle Farm & Education Center is a certified organic farm on conserved land along the Connecticut River in East Thetford, Vermont, just minutes from Norwich, Vermont, and Hanover, New Hampshire. The farm has 40 acres in crops, growing a variety of vegetables, small fruits, legumes, oilseed, grain crops, and flowers for the farmstand, farmers markets, wholesale accounts and large community supported agriculture (CSA) program. The farm kitchen transforms crops in to pickles, preserves and value added products, baked goods for the cafe, and fresh food for our community festivals and farm dinners. The Education Center hosts seasonal workshops, classes, farm tours, a self-guided tour, and teaching gardens promoting the use of sustainable food systems and farm based education. Farmstand and Hello Café are open May-October.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.name: Hartland Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/har.description: The Hartland Farmers Market is a collection of local farmers and crafters coming together to sell their goods to the local people, supporting local economy and supplying the freshest possible farm grown items. You can find something for everyone at our market!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kis.name: Kismet Kitchen
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kis.hours: Brunch Wednesday through Friday 11-2, Saturday 8-2, Sunday 9-2, Dinner Wednesday-Saturday 5-9
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/kis.description: Chef owned restaurant & catering company dedicated to local foods, sustainable regional seafoods & nurturing our community.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/caf.name: Cafe Mamie at the Southern Vermont Arts Center
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/caf.hours: June - October: Tues. - Sun.: 11:30 AM - 2:30 PM, November - May: Tues. - Sat.: 11:30 AM to 2:30 PM
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/caf.description: Beautiful 50 seat café housed in the solarium of the historic Yester House on the campus of the Southern Vermont Arts Center. Locally-sourced cuisine, fun custom cocktails, fabulous art and wonderful performances makes the trip up the hill worth making!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ric.name: Richmond Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ric.description: Spring has sprung! Come to the Richmond Farmers’ Market, support local producers, and enjoy the weather.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jer.name: Jericho Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/jer.description: At the Jericho Farmers' Market we serve the communities of Jericho and Underhill, Vermont as well as visitors from around the world and we look forward to having YOU join us.  We have 20+ vendors - our goal is to have 60% Agricultural products and the other 40% split between prepared foods and Artisans.  We are fortunate to have a number of dedicated veggie and fruit vendors including folks who specialize in heirloom tomatoes, beautiful, bountiful greens, multiple colors of potatoes, fragrant herbs and brilliant flowers.   We have herb, vegetable and flower starts, wool, honey, maple syrup and maple candy.  We have food vendors with sauces, marinades and preserves, fresh wholesome bread and yummy baked goods.   We have wooden bowls, herbal soaps, photos, felted bags, tee shirts.  We have prepared foods to eat at the picnic tables we've set up for you in the center of the market or to take home to go with your fresh veggies: soups, salads, samosas, moussaka, lasagna and more.  EBT and Debit accepted!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fla.name: Flack Family Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fla.hours: Call for appointment : 802-933-7752 Farm food is for sale at farm house throughout the year. Arrangements can be made to see the cows, the dairy, and the gardens. Willing workers are welcome.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/fla.description: Flack Family Farm, in the Vermont hills, is a biodynamic farm using organic practices. Natural minerals and planned grazing with American Milking Devon cattle rejuvenate the soil, sequester carbon and yield nutrient dense foods and medicines including milk, grass fed meats, eggs, fermented vegetables (sauerkraut and kimchi / kim-chi), and herbal tinctures. We offer educational opportunities, farm visits, and seminars on nutrition, growing and preparing nutrient dense food, diversified farming and fermentation. .

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/goo.name: Goodrich's Maple Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/goo.description: Free educational tours. Family owned and operated since 1840. Learn all about maple from our trees to your table. Gift shop, mail order, wide variety of award winning maple syrup and confections.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: Northshire Brewery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.hours: Tours by appointment only.  Call 802.681.0201 to schedule.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: Northshire Brewery is a craft brewery specializing in classically styled hand-made session beers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.name: Champlain Islands Farmers' Market - South Hero
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cha.description: The Champlain Islands Farmers' Market connects our community to the great farms, specialty food businesses, and artisan studios in the Champlain Islands. It is a vibrant market that provides the towns of Grand Isle and South Hero with a community gathering place, while acting as a marketplace for local businesses. Located in the beautiful Champlain Islands, surrounded by Lake Champlain and bordered by the Green Mountains of Vermont and the Adirondack Mountains of New York, we are a short drive from Burlington and Plattsburgh and a superb place for a day trip!  The Champlain Islands are filled with wonderful farm stands, restaurants, and cafés that use the highest quality local ingredients, and many fun activities like bicycle touring, fishing, and boating.The farmers' market represents the very best of local products available in our area.  Our vendors sell a wide range of products including: fresh vegetables, fruits, herbs, flowers, eggs, grass fed beef, pasture raised chicken, fresh baked breads, pastries, pies, ethnic dishes,  jams, pickles, applesauce, hand spun yarns, hand carved wooden bowls and tools, hand crafted jewelry and metalwork, hand-made soaps, and more.  We also hold special events throughout the summer including: live music, cooking demonstrations, and agricultural displays.  EBT and Debit accepted!Winter market meets at the Congregational Church on South Street in South Hero the third Friday of each month November thru March 4:00pm-7:00pm.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.name: Allenholm Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.hours: Open Seasonally Mon - Sun: 9:00am-5:00pm. Please call ahead before planning a visit.
categories: Farmstands & U-Pick, Farm Visits, Farm Stays, Inns & B&B's
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/all.description: Allenholm Farm is Vermont's oldest commercial apple orchard - in the Allen family since 1870.  Adjacent to our Petting Paddock is the Farm Store. Inside you will find a colorful array of Vermont products, such as Honey, Maple Syrup and Cheese. We sell our own unsweetened Empire Applesauce and spiced Apple Butter, as well as homemade jams and jellies - our specialty is Crab Apple Jelly. During the Summer you can enjoy homegrown vegetables from our gardens, and delicious small fruits such as raspberries, blueberries, plums, peaches, sweet and sour cherries. The Fall harvest brings in our Apple crop, sweet cider and South Hero Applefest!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mil.name: Milton Farmers' Market
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/mil.description: When you buy locally in Milton VT, directly from Milton area markets and farms, you help support your local Milton economy and in return you will get the freshest, best-tasting food available and help reduce the production of greenhouse gasses.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rea.name: Readmore Bed & Breakfast
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/rea.description: Our Historic Colonial Revival is a perfect destination for your romantic getaway. Set in the lovely village of Bellows Falls, Vermont, our home is comfortable, elegant, and a designated Green Hotel by the State of Vermont, as well as a member of the Vermont Fresh Network of local farmers and consumers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ant.name: Antidote
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ant.hours: Antidote is open Tuesday through Saturday at 3:00pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ant.description: The Antidote is a community based restaurant and speakeasy serving creatively fresh food and drink. Find us downstairs at our spacious and warm 35 Green Street location in downtown Vergennes, serving dinner and late nights Tuesday through Saturday.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sen.name: Sentinel Pine Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sen.description: Sentinel Pine Orchards is a 500-acre orchard that sits on the shores of Lake Champlain. This orchard has been in the Blodgett family for 45 years and was passed from father to son in 1999. This orchard is part of the Vermont Land Trust and will be preserved as agricultural land forever. We give tours and consultation about growing, picking and packing apples. People young and old enjoy coming to the orchard and learning about how to pick apples, how to care for the trees and the process of getting the apples ready for market.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.name: Cabot Creamery Cooperative Visitors Center
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.hours: 9:00am-5:00pm daily (June-Oct); Mon-Sat 9:00am-4:00pm (Nov-May); Mon-Sat 10:00am-4:00pm (Jan) - Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas & New Years Day
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/cab.description: Cabot Creamery Cooperative has been in continuous operation in Vermont since 1919, and makes a full line of cheeses, yogurt, sour cream, cottage cheese and butter. Best known as makers of “The World’s Best Cheddar,” Cabot is owned by 1270 dairy farm families located through New England and upstate New York.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hun.name: Hunger Mountain Co-op
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hun.description: Hunger Mountain Co-op is committed to the sustainability of local food artisans, organic farmers, and meat/poultry producers and offers a diverse selection of locally baked breads, artisan cheeses, and specialty wine & beer. Our deli/cafe features prepared foods, salads, meats, fish, and a wonderful coffee bar.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.name: Stowe Mountain Lodge-Solstice Restaurant
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/sto.description: Vermont is New England's most venerated location for farm fresh produce, heirloom grains and local craftsmanship. Stowe Mountain Lodge has partnered with local Vermont farmers, cheesemakers, and other talented artisans, as well as small farm advocacy groups like the Vermont Fresh Network and Chefs Collaborative, to create a dining experience that is unique to the area, both on the plate and throughout the restaurant environment. Guests will experience a connection to the land of Vermont through dishes that focus on freshness, simplicity, and seasonal flavors.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wel.name: Wellwood Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wel.hours: Open: 9am - 5pm, 7 Days a week during apple season
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/wel.description: Wellwood Orchards is a locally owned orchard that grows and sells all of our fruits on location. We grow many varieties of Apples, as well as Blueberries, Strawberries, Raspberries, Peaches, Plums, Pumpkins and more! While your here stop by our country store and grab some Vermont Maple Syrup, Vermont Hand Crafts, Honey and many other things. Don't forget the petting zoo!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.name: Vermont Grand View Farm
categories: Farm Stays, Inns & B&B's, Classes & Workshops
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/ver.description: We are a family fiber farm raising sheep, llamas, and angora rabbits for fiber. We offer VT yarns, fiber classes, as well as B&B Farm Stays. Our guests are served breakfast and dinner featuring our organically grown meats, eggs, and vegetables.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/arv.name: Arvad's Grill and Pub
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/arv.description: Arvad's Grill and Pub opened 21 years ago by locals Jeffrey and Maryanne Larkin.  Since day one they have worked to serve quality food created, in house, by some of the finest local products resulting in what we like to call 'Upscale Comfort Food'.  In addition to local food, Arvad's offers some of the finest Vermont beers on draft accompanied by a variety of your favorites from around the world in bottles.We take pride in our guests, our restaurant, our food, our beverages and our community.  We appreciate any and all feedback and encourage your questions and comments.  We are always working to give you the best experience we can and nothing makes us happier than a restaurant full of overly satisfied customers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/red.name: Red Hen Baking Co.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/red.hours: Mon - Sat 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Sundays – 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/red.description: Our mission is to produce premium quality breads and pastries with traditional methods and carefully selected high quality ingredients. To do this while striving to minimize our impact on the environment, to support the growers and producers of our ingredients, and to provide the finest baked goods and service to our customers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tur.name: Turkey Hill Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/tur.description: Turkey Hill Farm is a 50-acre diversified farm dedicated to self-sufficiency, sustainable practices, and education. The Moo-tique farmstore sells our farmstead creamline yogurt and fresh cheeses, fluid raw milk, eggs from pastured hens, frozen pasture-raised meats, artisan pizzas, maple syrup, t-shirts, sweatshirts, books, and a variety of products from neighboring farms. We also feature a spacious and comfortable on-farm apartment that accommodates up to four people in the same party – perfect for short- or long-term farmstays.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dou.name: Douglas Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dou.hours: 8 am to 5 pm everyday, berries permitting, Mid June - July
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dou.description: Douglas Orchards, located in Shoreham, Vermont,  is a 4th generation family farm. We grow mainly apples, but we planted Strawberries 30 years ago and started raspberries 10 years ago.   Four acres of strawberries are sold through PYO, as well as ½ acre of raspberries.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dak.name: Dakin Farm - South Burlington
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/dak.description: "What Vermont Tastes Like" - Experience the flavor of Vermont's finest pure Vermont Maple Syrup, cob-cmoked meats, thick-sliced bacon, aged cheddar cheese and other specialty foods.  See how they're made and enjoy the FREE samples!  In Spring - don't miss Sugaring Season and try our NEW Crop of Pure Vermont Maple Syrup (Mid March, Annually), In Summer - stop in for a delicious Maple Cremee!; In Fall - enjoy the beautiful colors of fall and sample smoked meats and Artisan cheeses; In Winter - send the very best of Vermont to loved ones - we are your holiday gift headquarters.  Located just off 1-89 exit 14E next to Barnes & Noble and EMSWe have a Ferrisburgh location as well!

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/new.name: Newport Natural Market and Cafe
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/new.description: Fresh produce and the highest quality meats go into our daily specials and sandwiches. We cater to all and any dietary needs. Gluten Free? we do that. Vegan? that too. We also have a good selection of wine and beer, many of them local.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hat.name: Hathaway Farm & Corn Maze
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hat.hours: 10am-5pm end of July-end of Oct/Call any other time of year
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hat.description: We have the largest corn maze in Vermont that operates for 3 months. We give farm tours, wagon rides, have pumpkin picking & a Livestock Barn. We raise & finish hereford & angus beef at our farm that is certified free of hormones & antibiotics. We sell our beef locally to individuals as well as restaurants & schools. We are also longtime maple producers.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.name: Green Mountain Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gre.description: Green Mountain Orchards is a 3rd generation hillside farm. Pick your own, or buy already picked apples, blueberries, and pumpkins. Try our own cider and sample the local cheese.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.name: Burtt's Apple Orchard
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.hours: Open from September 8th through October 31 Everyday 9am - 6pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/bur.description: Our orchard makes up a small six acre plot on our farm. The first trees were planted in 2005 and we are still planting! Designed as a pick-your-own orchard, the trees are planted so that several varieties of apples are within a short walking distance and branches are kept low so that picking is easy. With over 35 varieties there are many choices. Great views of the surrounding Cabot hillside farms and the Green Mountains, plenty of open space for walking and picnics, and people who enjoy simple fun round out the rest of the experience at our orchard.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.name: Nordic Center at Strafford Organic Creamery
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/nor.description: The Strafford Nordic Center is Vermont's newest premier cross-country skiing center located in Strafford, Vermont.Our initial  trail system is the backbone for a proposed 50 kilometer trail system being created on two locally owned well known farms.  The base lodge and trail head are located at Rockbottom Farm, a working organic dairy farm and home of the Strafford Organic Creamery.  Scenic ski trails are hosted on Rockbottom Farm's spacious fields and rolling hills.  Additional trails are hosted on Tamarack Hill Farm, long known for its high level equestrian training, gorgeous scenery and challenging terrain.  While enjoying a day of skiing on these two majestic Vermont farms, take in the long range views of Vermont and New Hampshire from the ridge line on the Outer Loop trail.  If cruising is more your style, try out the the rolling fields and winding woods trails.  Whatever type of skier you are, we have the trails you've been waiting for.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gol.name: Golden Russet Farm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/gol.description: Golden Russet Farm is a family-run organic farm in Shoreham, Vermont, near Lake Champlain. We grow a wide variety of summer and fall vegetables. In the spring, we offer bedding plants for your flower and vegetable gardens. Read about our Farm-to-Kitchen Connection, providing you with fresh organic vegetables and herbs all summer.Visit us at our farm in Shoreham, Vermont, off Route 22A, 1.3 miles west of the Halfway House Restaurant.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/res.name: Restaurant Sixty Battery at the Hilton Burlington
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/res.hours: Mon - Sat: 6:30 am - 8:00 pm Sun: 6:30 am - 2:00 pm
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/res.description: Eclectic items on the menu at this restaurant inside the Hilton Hotel have one thing in common -- fresh, local ingredients. There microbrews are from Vermont, too.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.name: Halladay’s Harvest Barn Inn
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.hours: Open 7 days a week; Check in time between 3 and 7 pm; Walk-ins welcome!
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/hal.description: Overlooking the Connecticut River, the Harvest Barn Inn offers breathtaking views, hearty breakfasts, and yoga/massage in a cozy setting. Close to skiing, hiking, fine dining, shopping, and historic sites. On-site event space. Packages available.

http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.name: Shelburne Orchards
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.hours: Open seasonally from mid-August through the end of October  Hours: Monday-Saturday 9:00 a.m.-6:00 p.m. Sunday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m.
http://www.diginvt.com/places/detail/she.description: Our 80 acres of apple trees are located on the shores of gorgeous Lake Champlain in Shelburne, Vermont. The orchard has been in my family since the 1950′s and I have been overseeing the place for over 30 years. We grow apples, peaches, and sour cherries here. The orchard also produces cider, non-alcoholic Ginger Jack, world-famous cider donuts, and we’ve just started distilling apple brandy. Next up is apple cider vinegar. Thanks so much for supporting farmers!
